102.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "The Holy Spirit (Angel Gibra´eel) brings the absolute truth from your Lord, in order to consolidate those who believe. It is the guidance and the glad tiding for the obedient."

103.Dr. Munir Munshey: And surely, We know what they allege! That a man has taught him (Mohammed, SAW)! The language of the one they allude to, however, is not Arabic, while this (Qur´an) is in precise and perfect Arabic

104.Dr. Munir Munshey: Surely, Allah does not guide those who refuse to believe in the verses of Allah. For them, there is the painful punishment

105.Dr. Munir Munshey: Surely, the unbelievers fabricate lies __ those who do not believe in the verses of Allah. They, indeed, are the liars

106.Dr. Munir Munshey: The one who denies after having first believed __ not the one who is coerced (into unbelief) while his heart is firm on belief, but rather the one who rejects with the full approval of his heart __ earns the wrath of Allah. For him, there is a tremendous punishment

107.Dr. Munir Munshey: Because they prefer the life of this world to that of the afterlife! Allah does not guide the nation of unbelievers

108.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah has sealed off their hearts, their hearing and their sight. They are careless and neglectful

109.Dr. Munir Munshey: No doubt at all! They will be the losers in the life-to-come

110.Dr. Munir Munshey: Surely, your Lord is the most Forgiving and the most Merciful for those who, having been tortured (for the sake of Allah), emigrate and continue to struggle and persevere patiently

111.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day, every soul will arrive squabbling about itself, and each will receive in full the result of its action. Not a soul will be treated unjustly

112.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah cites the example of a peaceful and tranquil town. It enjoyed abundance and opulence. Its provisions came to it from every source. But its inhabitants showed ingratitude towards the blessings of Allah. So, as a result of their deeds, Allah wrapped them in famine and fear

113.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, a messenger __ from amongst their own people __ had already come to them. But they called him a liar! So the punishment grabbed them. They were evildoers

114.Dr. Munir Munshey: Eat the allowable wholesome food Allah has provided, and show gratitude for the blessings of Allah __ if you in fact, worship Him exclusively

115.Dr. Munir Munshey: Dead animal, blood and swine-flesh are what Allah has forbidden for you, and also the offerings made to deities other than Allah. But if someone (eats because he) is forced by dire necessity __ not out of desire or habit __ then, surely Allah is the most Forgiving and the most Kind

116.Dr. Munir Munshey: You concoct lies about Allah! You blurt out and falsely claim some things to be permissible, others not! Those who fabricate lies about Allah will never prosper

117.Dr. Munir Munshey: (After this) brief enjoyment, theirs is the painful punishment

118.Dr. Munir Munshey: And for those who became Jews, We prescribed what We have described to you earlier. We did not oppress them. Rather, they used to treat their own selves unjustly

119.Dr. Munir Munshey: There are those who commit wrongful acts out of foolish ignorance, but later repent and make amends. Surely, for them your Lord is the most Forgiving and the most Kind

120.Dr. Munir Munshey: And Ibraheem was a nation (all by himself), obedient to Allah and a true believer. He was not an idolater

121.Dr. Munir Munshey: He was grateful for the blessings. (Allah) chose him and led him to the straight path

122.Dr. Munir Munshey: In this world, We gave him the bounties, and surely, in the afterlife, he will be amongst the righteous

123.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, We revealed to you to follow the nation of Ibraheem, the true believer. He was not an idolater

124.Dr. Munir Munshey: The Sabbath was something made obligatory upon those who quarreled about it. On the Day of Judgment your Lord will definitely decide and settle all matters in which they now differ

125.Dr. Munir Munshey: Call them towards the path of your Lord with wisdom and right advice, and debate with them amicably. Surely, your Lord knows very well who has deviated from His path, just as He knows best who are the well guided

126.Dr. Munir Munshey: Should you want to retaliate, get even only to the extent you were wronged. But to endure and bear calmly is much better for those who are steadfast

127.Dr. Munir Munshey: Be patient! The patience, too, comes from Allah! Do not grieve over them! Do not feel uneasy about their deceit

128.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course, Allah is on the side of the righteous and the beneficent

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Exalted is He Who took His servant one night from the sacred masjid (in Mecca) to the masjid in Jerusalem _ the vicinity of which We have blessed _ so that We may show him Our signs. Surely, He listens and hears all

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: We awarded Musa the book, and deemed it to be the directive for the Israelites, that they should not accept anyone other than Me as their Lord

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh you, the sons of those whom We put aboard (a ship) with Nooh! Surely, he was a grateful person

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: In the book, We foretold the destiny of Israelites, "Twice you will cause severe mischief in the land and exceed greatly in arrogance."

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: "At the time of the first prediction (mischief), We sent (in combat) against you, one of Our powerful nations. They were well versed in warfare and they stormed through your homes. The promise had to come true."

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then (when you repented), We restored you back to power. We bolstered you with resources and offspring and caused you to abound in numbers. (And said)

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Your good deeds are for your own good, and similarly, your bad deeds are to afflict your own self!" At the time of the second prediction, (We sent another nation) to mangle your faces and to run over your masjid just like the first time, and to lay in ruin everything they laid their hands on."

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Maybe (now) your Lord will have mercy on you. But if you repeat (your offense), We shall reinstate (Our punishment). We have fashioned hell to be a prison for the unbelievers."

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, this Qur´an leads on to an appropriate and secure path. It gives the good news to those who perform righteous deeds, that theirs is a great reward

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: And We have prepared a painful punishment for those who do not believe in the afterlife

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: Man covets wickedness as if it were something admirable; man happens to be hasty

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: We appointed both the night and the day as signs. One of the signs _ the night _ We made dim, while We made the day bright and full of light, so that you may seek the blessings of your Lord, and so that you may count the years and have a measure of time. Thus, We have explained everything in detail

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have forced each one´s actions to hang around his neck. On the Day of Judgment, We will bring out his record of deeds; he will find it an open book

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Read your record! Today, even you shall suffice to evaluate your own self!"

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: The one who adopts the guidance (of the Qur´an) does so only for his own benefit. The one who strays also does so for his own self. No soul shall carry another´s burden! We never inflict punishment, unless We have already sent around messengers

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: When We resolve to ruin a town, (and before We actually destroy it), We first order its affluent inhabitants (to obey). They carry on their lives of sin. So the prediction (against them) comes to pass. Thereafter, We finish them off completely

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: Many towns have We destroyed after Nooh. Your Lord is Aware, and He is enough to watch over the sins of His created beings

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: We grant the wishes in this (transitory) world _ whatever We please and for whomever We decide. For the one who prefers this temporal existence, We have prepared hell (in the hereafter). He will join it, cursed and ostracized

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: Provided he is a believer, anyone who desires (the rewards of) the afterlife and strives effectively for it, will discover that his efforts have found acceptance

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: We bestow the bounties of your Lord to both _ this group as well as that. The grant of your Lord is not restricted

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: But observe how We, in this world, excel some over others; and the afterlife is bigger in status and higher in esteem

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do not associate any god with Allah, else you shall find yourself cursed and abandoned

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: Your Lord has decreed that you should not worship anyone other than Him, and that you treat your parents well. When either, or both of them, reach an old age do not grumble and do not be angry with them. Rather, always have kind words to say to them.

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: Be responsive to them and treat them with kindness and compassion, and say, "Oh my Lord. Have mercy on them as they brought me up when I was a small child."

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: Your Lord is fully aware of the thoughts that cross your mind. If you are righteous (then remember), your Lord forgives those who turn to Him in repentance

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: And honor the rights of the kinsfolk, the poor and needy, and the homeless; and do not be overly wasteful

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: Surely, the spendthrift are the brothers of Shaitan; and Shaitan is ungrateful to his Lord

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: Speak to them politely even if you must decline them, because you might still be awaiting and looking for the blessings of your Lord

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do not have your hands restrained to your neck (do not be stingy), nor stretch them free and unfettered (nor be a spendthrift), lest you later feel sorry and constrained

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: Your Lord certainly provides the provisions in abundance _ or limits them _ to whomever He pleases. Indeed, He is all Knowing, and Watchful over His servants

31.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do not, out of fear of poverty, put your offspring to death. We shall provide them as well as you, the means of life. Killing your offspring is a blunder of a grave proportion

32.Dr. Munir Munshey: And do not even wander close to extra marital sex. Indeed, adultery is a way of decadence

33.Dr. Munir Munshey: And do not kill anyone. Allah has prohibited it, except when it is rightful and befitting (and corresponds to the crime). We have awarded a right (of redress) to the heir of a person wrongfully killed. But let him not exceed the bounds and overdo in (his quest to seek redress by) killing. He is to be helped

34.Dr. Munir Munshey: And do not approach the assets of an orphan except with noble intentions, right until he comes of age. Honor your pacts! Surely you are answerable for your pacts

35.Dr. Munir Munshey: When you measure, be exact (do not curtail); and when you weigh, use the correct and proper scales (do not diminish). This is beneficial for you, and better in consequences

36.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do not take a stand about anything you have no knowledge of. Indeed, the ears the eyes and the heart have all to render an account

37.Dr. Munir Munshey: And do not walk on the earth arrogantly. You will neither wear down the earth, nor match the stature of the mountains

38.Dr. Munir Munshey: All of that is wrong and despised by your Lord

39.Dr. Munir Munshey: This wisdom is revealed to you by your Lord! Do not accept any god other than Allah; else you will be hurled into hell _ cursed and ostracized

40.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Oh you who accept gods other than Allah), did your Lord favor you with sons while He settled on angels as daughters for Himself? Surely what you utter is a grave thing

41.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have repeatedly explained matters in this Qur´an, so they may come to their senses. But it has only intensified their aversion (for the truth)

42.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say

43.Dr. Munir Munshey: Glorified is He! Exalted and far above what they assert

44.Dr. Munir Munshey: The seven heavens, the earth, and all those who exist therein, glorify Him. There isn´t anything that does not chant His praises! But you fail to (hear their chants, or) comprehend their manner of praise. Surely, He is Gentle and Forgiving

45.Dr. Munir Munshey: As you recite the Qur´an, We station an invisible shield between you and those who do not believe in the afterlife

46.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have encased their hearts in covers, so they understand nothing; and their ears are plugged with corks. When you mention none but your Lord in the Qur´an, they scornfully turn their backs on you

47.Dr. Munir Munshey: We know (their motives) very well. We know what they (want to) hear when they listen to you closely! When the evildoers talk secretly (with their companions), they say, "You are merely following a man possessed."

48.Dr. Munir Munshey: See! How they depict you? They have strayed off and cannot find the way

49.Dr. Munir Munshey: They ask, "Once we turn into dust and bones, will we be raised back to a renewed existence?"

50.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "(Yes! Indeed, even if you) turn into stone or steel!"

51.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Or any other matter which, in your mind is harder (to resurrect)." They will say, "Who will bring us back?" Say, "The One who brought you into being the first time!" Then, they will shake their heads at you and say, "When will that happen?" Say, "It might be close at hand!"

52.Dr. Munir Munshey: When He orders you to emerge on that day, you will comply (and come out) singing praises for Him. You will assume that you had stayed on this earth only for a brief while

53.Dr. Munir Munshey: Tell My servants to always say the right thing! Surely, Shaitan incites them to do evil. Shaitan is the professed enemy of the human beings

54.Dr. Munir Munshey: Your Lord knows your circumstances very well. If He pleases He will have mercy on you, and He will punish you if He so please. (Oh Muhammad, SAW) We did not appoint you a manager over them

55.Dr. Munir Munshey: Your Lord knows all those in the heavens and the earth. He has exalted some messengers over others; He gave Da´ood the Zaboor (the book ´Psalm´ in Bible)

56.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Call those you claim (to be gods) beside Him. They do not possess any ability either to remove, or to modify any hardship."

57.Dr. Munir Munshey: They themselves pray to Him and vie each other to seek the means to get closer to Him. They hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord deserves to be feared

58.Dr. Munir Munshey: There is no town that We will not destroy _ or punish severely _ before the Day of Judgment. This is inscribed in the book of decrees

59.Dr. Munir Munshey: Nothing prevents Us from producing miracles. But the earlier people had rejected them! We assigned the camel as a proof for the people of ´Samood´, but they committed an outrage. We only display signs to serve as a warning

60.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Remember) We said to you that your Lord has confined and contained people. We appointed the vision, _ the one we showed you _ and the mention of the cursed tree (the tree of ´zaqum´) in the Qur´an to be a trial for the people. We alerted them. Yet, it only increased their defiance immensely

61.Dr. Munir Munshey: When We told the angels to fall prostrate before Adam they did, except Iblees! He said "Shall I fall prostrate before the one You have fashioned from clay?"

62.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said, "Look at him! You gave him precedence over me? If You give me an opportunity till the Day of Judgment, I will outwit and mislead their entire generations! (Only) a few will escape my lure!"

63.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "Get out of here! Hell is the just recompense, a plentiful penalty for both _ you and those of them who follow you."

64.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Tempt and allure them _ anyone among them you can _ with your sly talk. Raid them with your horses and men, bamboozle a share in their wealth and children, and hold out (false) promises for them." Surely Shaitan´s promise is nothing but an illusion

65.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course, you shall have no hold over My servants; your Lord is sufficient as a Trustee

66.Dr. Munir Munshey: Your Lord makes the ship sail in the ocean so you could seek His blessings. Indeed, He is ever so merciful towards you

67.Dr. Munir Munshey: When trouble strikes you at sea, all those you invoke except Him, vanish (from your consciousness). And when He rescues you (and leads you) back to shore, you again turn away! Man is most ungrateful

68.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do you then feel secure that He will not cause you to sink and go under even on dry land? Or send hurricanes upon you and no one will be there to guard you

69.Dr. Munir Munshey: Or are you sure that He will not make you go back to sea for a second time, send a cyclone upon you and drown you for your disbelief? Then, you will find no one to assist you against Us

70.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, We have honored the descendants of Adam. We let them move about in the land and sea, provided them wholesome food, and markedly excelled them over many of Our other created species

71.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day, We will summon all human beings with their record of deeds. Those given their records in their right (hand) will read it (eagerly). They shall not be wronged a bit

72.Dr. Munir Munshey: The one who (refuses to see, and so) does not see in this life, will be blind in the afterlife; he shall be farther away from the way

73.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Oh prophet!) They almost succeeded in enticing you away from Our revelations, in almost getting you to declare something contrary to Our revelations. They would have then called you a friend

74.Dr. Munir Munshey: Had We not kept you staunch, you would surely have begun to lean a little towards them

75.Dr. Munir Munshey: If so, We would have you taste the torment _ twice as much in life and twice as severe after death. You would not find any helper against Us

76.Dr. Munir Munshey: They had stirred you up enough and had almost succeeded in driving you out of the land. If so, they too, had not stayed behind much longer

77.Dr. Munir Munshey: This was Our established practice with every messenger We sent prior to you. You will not detect any departure in Our practice

78.Dr. Munir Munshey: And stand in prayers from sunset till dusk, and recite the Qur´an at dawn. Surely, the recitation of the Qur´an at dawn is well attended (by angels)

79.Dr. Munir Munshey: And prior to dawn, perform the tahajjud (non-obligatory) prayer at night. Your Lord may elevate you to the most exalted status (in heaven)

80.Dr. Munir Munshey: And say, "Oh Lord, usher me into the threshold (of events in life) with the truth; and take me through the outcome (of events) with the truth, and by Your grace appoint for me a mighty ally."

81.Dr. Munir Munshey: And say, "The truth is here and falsehood has ceased to be! Indeed, falsehood is ever bound to vanish!"

82.Dr. Munir Munshey: That which We revealed in the Qur´an is the mercy and the cure for the believers, and it only multiplies the losses of the evil doers

83.Dr. Munir Munshey: Man stays aloof and disregards (the message) when We make (life) pleasant for him, and despairs when he encounters a calamity

84.Dr. Munir Munshey: Each one acts according to his own way. Your Lord knows better those, who are well guided and on the (straight) path

85.Dr. Munir Munshey: They ask your opinion about the ´Rooh´ (the soul)! Say, "The ´Rooh´ (the soul) is by the command of your Lord. The knowledge imparted to you is just so scanty!"

86.Dr. Munir Munshey: Surely, if We please We could revoke the knowledge revealed to you thus far. Then, you will find nothing to promote your cause with Us

87.Dr. Munir Munshey: Other than mercy from your Lord! Indeed, His favors upon you are enormous

88.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "If the humans and jinn were to assemble in an attempt to create anything akin to this Qur´an, they would definitely fail, even if they assisted each other!"

89.Dr. Munir Munshey: In this Qur´an, We have thoroughly explained all sorts of examples. But most folks reject everything and insist upon disbelieving

90.Dr. Munir Munshey: They say, "We would never believe you unless you could cause springs to gush out of the earth."

91.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Or (unless) you owned orchards of dates and grapes, and commandeered rivers to flow through them."

92.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Or (else, we dare you to) make the sky tumble down upon us in pieces _ like you claim it might _ and have Allah and His angels appear (face to face) before us."

93.Dr. Munir Munshey: "(We might believe you) if your house was made of gold, or you were to rise up into the sky. And we would only trust your ascension if you brought down a book for us to read (and verify)!" Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Am I not just a human being appointed to be His messenger?"

94.Dr. Munir Munshey: Nothing prevented people from accepting the guidance once it had arrived, except that they cynically raised the question, "Has Allah appointed a human being to be His messenger?"

95.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Had angels populated the earth, _ moving about peacefully in it _ We would certainly have sent another angel from heaven as a messenger for them."

96.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Allah is a sufficient witness between you and me. Indeed He watches over His servants and is well Aware."

97.Dr. Munir Munshey: The one whom Allah shows the way is indeed well guided! And you will not find any helper other than Him, for the one whom Allah leads astray. We will gather all such people on the Day of Judgment. Blind, dumb and deaf, they shall lie flat on their faces. Hell is to be their abode! We shall ignite the hellfire into a blazing inferno whenever it begins to subside

98.Dr. Munir Munshey: Such shall be their punishment. They rejected Our signs and asked, "Once we are bones and bits, will we be awakened into a renewed existence?"

99.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do they not see? Allah Who created the heavens and the earth, is capable of creating the likes of them (anew), and of assigning a specific time (for them). There is no doubt about it. The evil doers insist upon disbelief

100.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Even if you had treasures of what my Lord blessed you with, you would still, for fear of poverty, hold it back (not spend it)." Man is indeed stingy

101.Dr. Munir Munshey: We had granted Musa nine very clear proofs. Ask the children of Israel! When (the proofs) appeared before them, the pharaoh said, "Indeed, Oh Musa, I think you are a man possessed!"

102.Dr. Munir Munshey: Musa said, "You of course know that these signs are definitely the eye opening proofs from the Lord of the heavens and the earth! Indeed, oh Pharaoh, I think you are ready to be ruined!"

103.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, he resolved to dislodge them (the children of Israel) from the land, but We drowned him and all those with him

104.Dr. Munir Munshey: Later, to the children of Israel We said, "Inhabit the earth till the promise of the afterlife is fulfilled. Then, We will bring you out as a crowd."

105.Dr. Munir Munshey: We revealed it (the Qur´an) as an absolute truth and it came (to you) as an absolute truth! In fact, We have appointed you as just a bearer of glad tidings, and as a Warner

106.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have segmented this Qur´an in parts, so you may recite it to the people a little at a time. We have revealed it gradually, step by step

107.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "You may believe in this Qur´an or choose not to. But, when it is read to those who know the scriptures, they (are overwhelmed, and) fall down on their faces in prostration."

108.Dr. Munir Munshey: And they say, "Our Lord is exalted. Our Lord´s promise shall definitely happen!"

109.Dr. Munir Munshey: They fall down on their faces, choked up and sobbing. It (the Qur´an) fills them with humbleness

110.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Call Him Allah, or call him Rehman. Whichever name you call Him by, (remember) His attributes are the most beautiful. During your ´salat´, do not raise your voice too loud, nor lower it to a virtual whisper. Rather, adopt a moderate tone."

111.Dr. Munir Munshey: And say, "All praise is for Allah Who did not beget a son, and Who shares the Lordship of His domain with none! And He (has no weakness, therefore) requires no friend to mask any weakness. So, Glorify Him for His Greatness and Majesty

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: All the praise belongs to Allah, Who revealed the book to His servant, and in it is included nothing queer

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: (It is) straightforward, to sound a prior warning about His stern punishment, and to deliver the happy news to the believers, _ those of them with good deeds _ that theirs shall be the bountiful rewards

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: In it (the paradise), they shall reside forever

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: And to admonish those who claim that Allah has begotten a son

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: Regarding that, neither they nor their forefathers had any knowledge. Presumptuous are the words that escape their lips! What they utter is nothing but a falsehood

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Would you, then, be overcome with sorrow and agonize over their refusal to accept this message (contained in the Qur´an)

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have, in fact, fashioned everything in this world as mere adornments in order to test them! To see who amongst them performs the righteous deeds

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: And We are definitely going to convert the earth into a bone-dry barren plateau

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do you regard the companions of the cave and the inscription tablet (upon the cave) as exceptional marvels among Our signs

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: Those young men sought refuge in the cave and said, "Our Lord! By Your grace, grant us Your mercy and resolve our affairs suitably!"

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: So, in that cave We lulled them to sleep for many years

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, (many years later) We awakened them so We may know which of their groups correctly estimates the length of their stay in the cave

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: We narrate to you their true tale. The young men had faith in their Lord, and We enhanced them in guidance

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: We fortified their hearts because they stood firm and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth! We shall call upon no god other than Him. Else, we shall have severely exceeded the bounds."

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: "This nation of ours accepts gods other than Him. Why do they not give a valid justification in support? Who then, is more evil than the one inventing lies about Allah?"

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Seek refuge in that cave, now that you have parted company with them, as well as those they worship other than Allah. Your Lord will shower His mercy upon you and will attend to your needs and comforts."

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Had you been there) you would see (the rays of) the sun _ as it rises and sets _ falling obliquely across the right of the cave and turning away past its left, while the men lay in the midst (of the cave). These are the signs of Allah. The rightly guided is the one whom Allah guides. You will not find any patron to guide the one who is led astray

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: You would think they were awake, although they were asleep. We rolled them on their sides _ right and left. With outstretched limbs, their dog lay close to the entrance (of the cave). Had you just caught a glimpse of them, you would be struck with terror and you would turn around and flee

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: Thus We awakened them so they may question one another. One of them asked, "How long did we stay (here)?" Others responded, "A day! Perhaps less!" They all said, "Our Lord alone knows how long we stayed (in this cave). Let us send one of us to the town with this coin. With it, let him buy and bring to us the best, most wholesome food. And let him proceed with caution. Let no one know about you!"

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: "If they overcome you they may stone you to death, or compel you to rejoin their faith. In the later case, you will never ever be successful."

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: In that miraculous manner, We made them (the people) stumble upon (that cave). So that they would know for sure that Allah´s promise is real, and that there is no doubt about the hour (of judgment). But instead, they carried on their dispute and said, "Let us build a monument over them. Only their Lord knows the truth about them!" Those who were in charge said, "We shall definitely turn the site into a place of worship."

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: They will say, "(That they were) three, the fourth was their dog." Others also conjecture (and put the figure at) five, counting the dog six. Still others say, "Seven! Their dog was the eighth." Say, "My Lord knows their true number! Others know only very little." So, do not discuss that about them except cursorily, nor inquire anyone about them

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: And regarding anything, do not say, "I will do that tomorrow."

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Rather add), "If Allah pleases!" (Insha Allah)! Should you forget this, then remember your Lord (when you recall) and say, "Perhaps, my Lord will lead me towards that which is more appropriate, and a sensible conduct."

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: They stayed in that cave for three centuries, and nine more years

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: And say, "Allah knows exactly how long they stayed! To Him belong the secrets of the heavens and the earth! He hears (everything) clearly, and He sees (everything) plainly. They have no patrons besides Him, and He includes none in His decisions and domain."

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: And recite (without modification) the revelation from the book of your Lord. No one may change the words of your Lord! (If you did) you will not find any safe place from Him

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: Be contented with yourself and with those who pray to their Lord morning and evening, seeking His pleasure. Do not turn your eyes away from them, nor seek the allure of the life of this world. Do not follow anyone who slams his mind shut upon Our advice, follows his own whims and is immoderate in his affairs

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "This is the truth! It is from your Lord! So, (now) whoever wants may believe it. If anyone wishes to disbelieve, let him." For the evildoers We have prepared a fire. Like a canopy of conflagration, it will surround them completely. They shall plead for help and shall be treated with water _ more like boiling oil _ which will scald their mouths. A miserable drink served in a wretched place

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: And We will definitely not waste the rewards of the believers _ those who do good deeds

31.Dr. Munir Munshey: These are the ones! There exists for them an eternal paradise with rivers flowing right through. As ornaments, they shall don bracelets made of gold, and their garments will be made of lush green silk and brocade. They shall rest poised on elevated thrones. What an excellent apparel in an exquisite place

32.Dr. Munir Munshey: And quote the parable of the two men. We gave one of them two gardens of grapes, each bordered with date trees. Between (these gardens) We placed cultivated fields of green crops

33.Dr. Munir Munshey: The vine gardens held back nothing. Both of them bore their fruit to the maximum. We ran a stream between the two gardens

34.Dr. Munir Munshey: And thus he benefited a lot. While talking to his friend once, he said, "I am better than you in wealth as well as slaves, sons and other personnel."

35.Dr. Munir Munshey: While entering his garden he committed an outrage upon his own self (he was boastful and cynical). He said, "I do not think all this will ever perish!"

36.Dr. Munir Munshey: "The hour (of judgment) I think, will not occur. If at all I am sent back to my Lord, I shall find even better bounties reserved for me."

37.Dr. Munir Munshey: His companion conversed with him and said, "Aren´t you being ungrateful to the One Who created you; first from dust then from a drop of semen, and then shaped you into a man?"

38.Dr. Munir Munshey: "As far as I am concerned, Allah is my Lord. I will never associate anyone with my Lord."

39.Dr. Munir Munshey: "So, upon entering your garden, why did you not say, ´If Allah wills! (Insha Allah)´. There is no power except that of Allah! (At present) you find me possessing fewer children and riches than you do."

40.Dr. Munir Munshey: "It is possible that my Lord may yet grant me a better garden, while he may strike yours (with a bolt) from the blue, leaving it slippery and barren."

41.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Or its water may sink deep underground, and you will be unable to retrieve it."

42.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Destruction) closed in on his fruit all around. He wrung his hands in remorse and lamented over what he had spent (and lost) on the garden. It lay in ruin, dreary and desolate. He said, "If only I hadn´t committed a ´shirk´ (ascribed associates) with my Lord."

43.Dr. Munir Munshey: Except Allah nobody could help him, nor could he help himself

44.Dr. Munir Munshey: At that time (he knew that) the actual authority belongs only to Allah, the real and true (God). The rewards and consequences He bestows are far better

45.Dr. Munir Munshey: And explain to them by quoting this example: the life of this world is like water We sent down from the sky. The plants assimilate it and become fresh and green. Later they turn into chaff, which the wind scatters around. Indeed, Allah has mastery over all things

46.Dr. Munir Munshey: The wealth and children are mere adornments for the life of this world. In the eyes of Allah, the good deeds one leaves behind are better in terms of expectations and outcome

47.Dr. Munir Munshey: You will see the earth turned into an even field when We cause the mountains to become pulverized (into clouds of dust). We will gather all of them together. None shall be absent

48.Dr. Munir Munshey: They shall be made to line up before their Lord in rows. (Allah will say), "Now! You have arrived before Us just as We created you the first time! And you thought We would not appoint a time (of reckoning) for you!"

49.Dr. Munir Munshey: The book (of deeds) shall be placed. And you will find the criminals panicky, afraid of what it might contain. They will say, "Oh, pity on us! What a book! Nothing is missing in it! Every single thing _ minor as well as major _ has been listed!" They will find everything they ever did, described (in the book in detail). Your Lord will be unfair to no one

50.Dr. Munir Munshey: When We ordered the Angels to prostrate themselves before Adam, they all did _ except Iblees (Shaitan). He is a jinn and he defied the command of your Lord. Yet, instead of Me (Allah) you accept him (Shaitan) and his descendants, as friends _ even though they are the enemies. Evil is the final end of the evil doers

51.Dr. Munir Munshey: I did not let them witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor the creation of their own selves. I wouldn´t accept as aides those who lead men astray

52.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day He will say, "Go on! Scream and call (for help) all those you claimed were My partners". And call they would, indeed! But they shall receive no response! We shall place a barrier between them

53.Dr. Munir Munshey: The criminals (that day) will witness the hellfire, fearing that they will (inevitably) fall into it. They will find no way to escape

54.Dr. Munir Munshey: Surely, We have mentioned in this Qur´an all sorts of examples for the people. But man happens to be more bickersome than anything

55.Dr. Munir Munshey: Now that the guidance is here, nothing must keep people from believing and seeking forgiveness from their Lord. Else, the tradition of the earlier folks would be repeated, and they would come face to face with a severe torment

56.Dr. Munir Munshey: We sent the messengers only as bearers of glad tidings, and as warners. But the unbelievers quarrel. They attempt to refute the truth with baseless discussions. They mock My signs and that about which they´re being warned

57.Dr. Munir Munshey: Who could be worse than the one who turns away and shuns the signs of his Lord, even though he is being reminded of them? He forgets the kinds of deeds he has committed. Indeed, We have set a lid over their hearts; so they fail to understand (the Qur´an). There exists a heavy load in their ears. Therefore, you may call them towards the truth, but they shall not be led on to the right path

58.Dr. Munir Munshey: Your Lord is the most Forgiving; He is the Lord of Mercy. If He were to grab them over all (the sins) they gather He would punish them instantly. But, their time (of reckoning) is preordained. Beyond that, they shall find no refuge

59.Dr. Munir Munshey: We brought to ruin all those towns because they were wicked. We fixed a specific time for the destruction (of each town)

60.Dr. Munir Munshey: (And tell them) when Musa said to his attendant, "I will not give up. I will keep going till I reach the confluence of the rivers, even if it takes several years."

61.Dr. Munir Munshey: They reached the confluence, but forgot the fish (they had with them). It slipped away and found its way into the sea

62.Dr. Munir Munshey: When they went past (the confluence) he (Musa) said to the attendant, "Prepare our meal. We have really suffered so much fatigue in this journey."

63.Dr. Munir Munshey: The attendant replied, "Did you see what happened? We were relaxing upon that cliff and I lost sight of the fish! It was Shaitan! He made me forget to mention it. The fish mysteriously found its way into the sea."

64.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Musa) said, "That (sign) is precisely what we were looking for!" So they retraced their steps and went back (to that cliff)

65.Dr. Munir Munshey: There, they met Our servant. We had showered Our mercy upon him, and had taught him (a special) knowledge

66.Dr. Munir Munshey: Musa asked, "May I follow you? Can you impart to me the (special) guidance you have been taught?"

67.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said, "I am sure you will not be able to bear me with patience!"

68.Dr. Munir Munshey: "How can you remain patient about something you have no knowledge of?"

69.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Musa) said, "Allah willing, you will find me a patient person. I will not disobey you in any matter!"

70.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said, "You may accompany me but do not ask any questions until I bring the matter up myself."

71.Dr. Munir Munshey: So they proceeded till they boarded a ship. The man drilled a hole (in its keel). (Musa) said, "You bore a hole in the ship to drown all its passengers. You have no doubt committed a dreadful act!"

72.Dr. Munir Munshey: (The man) said, "Did I not warn you? You will not be able to put up with me so patiently."

73.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Musa) said, "Do not blame me. I forgot. Do not make me undergo such a trying situation."

74.Dr. Munir Munshey: They proceeded again till they met a lad. The man killed him. (Musa) said, "You have taken an innocent life without any justification. Of course, you committed an evil act!"

75.Dr. Munir Munshey: (The man) said, "Did I not tell you? Indeed, you would be unable to bear me with patience."

76.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Musa) said, "Don´t let me accompany you if I ask anything after this! There, you now have a reason (to part company)."

77.Dr. Munir Munshey: The two men resumed (their journey), reached a town and requested food. The townfolks refused to put them up as guests. In the town, the man found a wall about ready to crumble. (The man) repaired it. (Musa) said, "Of course, if you wanted, you could have charged them for it."

78.Dr. Munir Munshey: (The Man) said, "This is where we bid farewell to each other! I will give you the explanation of the things you could not endure!"

79.Dr. Munir Munshey: "As for the ship, it belongs to some poor folks who operate it in the sea. I sought to make it defective; a king nearby, seizes all the (defect-free) ships forcibly."

80.Dr. Munir Munshey: "As for the boy, his parents are true believers. We feared that he would (grow up to) disobey them, oppress them and make them suffer tremendously."

81.Dr. Munir Munshey: "We wished that their Lord would grant them in exchange a just, honest and a more merciful (offspring)."

82.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And buried under the wall is a treasure. It belongs to two orphan brothers in town. Their father was pious! Your Lord decreed that (the boys) should discover (the treasure) when they attain the age of maturity. A mercy from your Lord. I did nothing of my own accord. That, in fact, was the reality which you witnessed but could not endure."

83.Dr. Munir Munshey: They inquire about Dhul Qurnain. Say, "Here, I will tell you about him."

84.Dr. Munir Munshey: We established him firmly in the land and laid at his disposal the means to obtain everything

85.Dr. Munir Munshey: He undertook a missio

86.Dr. Munir Munshey: And reached the land of the setting sun. He saw the sun setting behind the murky hot springs. And he found a people living there nearby. We said, "Oh Dhul Qurnain! You may punish them, or treat them nicely."

87.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said, "We will punish the evil doer ourselves. Later, he returns to his Lord, Who will punish him with a woeful torture."

88.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Dhul Qurnain said), "But the best of reward _ (paradise) _ is for the one who believes and acts righteously. We will treat him with kindness."

89.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then he undertook another mission (eastward)

90.Dr. Munir Munshey: (And pressed on) till he reached the land of the rising sun. He found the sun rising upon a (primitive) people. We had not arranged any shelter for them against the sun

91.Dr. Munir Munshey: Such (was their state); and We knew exactly what he (Dhul Qurnain) possessed

92.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then he went on yet another mission

93.Dr. Munir Munshey: Until he reached a mountainous area and found in the valley a people who understood almost nothing

94.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "These Yajog and Majog run amock in the land. May we pay you a tax to have a barrier erected between them and us?"

95.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "(Thanks, but) the power my Lord has granted is enough (and far better)! Just help me with your manpower. I shall build a wall between them and you."

96.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Bring me blocks of steel." He blocked up the valley between the mountains (with a wall of steel) and said. "Now start a fire and blow (air through your bellows) till the wall becomes red hot." Then he said, "Bring me the molten copper to pour over the (iron) wall."

97.Dr. Munir Munshey: The barbarians could neither scale (the wall) nor breach it

98.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "This is my Lord´s mercy upon you! (However) when the time comes for (the fulfillment of) my Lord´s promise, He will demolish it! My Lord´s promise is absolutely true!"

99.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day We will leave them rolling over each other (like waves), and then the trumpet will sound and We will gather them all together

100.Dr. Munir Munshey: And We shall display and bring within sight hell for the unbelievers

101.Dr. Munir Munshey: Those, whose eyes are sheathed (and insulated) against My reminder (the Qur´an) cannot stand even to listen to it

102.Dr. Munir Munshey: Did the unbelievers suppose that they can take _ instead of Me _ My slaves as their masters and get away with it? Indeed! To do them the honors, We have prepared hell

103.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "May we tell you about the worst of the losers?"

104.Dr. Munir Munshey: "They are those who (in reality) squander away their efforts in the life of this world, yet regard their deeds to be good."

105.Dr. Munir Munshey: Such are the ones who reject the signs of their Lord and the (forthcoming) meeting with Him. So their efforts amount to nothing. On the Day of Judgment, We shall assign them no weight at all

106.Dr. Munir Munshey: They shall have their reward _ hell. Because they disbelieved, and mocked My signs and My messengers

107.Dr. Munir Munshey: On the other hand, those who believe and do good deeds shall be honored with (the gift of) the gardens of paradise

108.Dr. Munir Munshey: There they shall live forever. They shall never desire to depart

109.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Had the ocean served as ink to write about Allah, then surely the ocean would run out, but the narrative about Allah would not. Even if We supplied that much more ink as a refill!"

110.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Surely, I am just a man like you. Revelation has been sent to me that your God is only one God! Hence, those hoping to meet their Lord should seek the righteous acts, and should not accept any partners in the worship of their Lord!"

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Kaaf, Ya, Ain, Saad

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: This is the account of the blessings of your Lord upon Zakaria, His servant

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: When once he addressed his Lord in a soft voice

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "Lord! My bones have weakened and my head has lit up with the gray hair (of old age). I haven´t so far been denied anything I ever prayed to You for."

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: "I am concerned for my followers after my death. My wife is barren. But, please Lord! Grant me by Your grace a successor (son)."

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: "One who may inherit from me and from the family of Yaqub, and Lord, please let him be amongst those with whom You are well-pleased."

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Oh Zakaria, We give you the good news of a son. His name shall be Yahya! Never before have We created anyone with his kind of qualities!"

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "Lord! How could I have a son now? My wife is barren and I have attained a ripe old age."

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "That shall be!" Your Lord said, "This is really easy for Me! I also gave you existence earlier when you were nothing!"

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "Lord! Assign a sign for me." Said, "Despite being healthy, you shall be unable to speak for three days. That shall be your sign!"

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: He emerged from the chamber, and gestured to his followers asking them to sing the praises (of Allah), morning and evening

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Oh Yahya! Hold on to the book with all your might!" We gave him the wisdom even as a lad

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: And by Our grace, We granted him compassion and purity; he was pious

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: He was devoted and kind to his parents; not defiant or arrogant

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: Peace be upon him, the day he was born! The day he died! And the day he shall be brought back to life

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: And mention Mary in your narration. Once she excused herself from her family and retired to the eastern wing of the house

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: She drew the curtain behind her and there, We sent Our spirit (angel) to her! It appeared before her in the figure of a full grown man

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: She cried out, "I seek the protection of Rehman (the Merciful) from you, if you are a God-fearing person!"

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said, "What I am, is a messenger of your Lord to bestow upon you a pious son."

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "How might I have a son? No man has ever touched me, nor am I a woman of loose morals."

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said "It shall be! Your Lord says ´It is really too easy for Me´! It is preordained and shall come to pass, so as to make him a sign for the humankind and a blessing from Us´."

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: She conceived and moved to a place far away

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: The distress of labor brought her under a date-palm tree. She said to herself, "I wish I was dead, long gone and forgotten before this ever happened."

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: He (the angel) called her from close by, "Do not feel sorry for yourself. Your Lord has issued forth a spring right close to where you are!"

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Shake the trunk of the date tree. Moist ripe dates will break loose and fall down."

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Eat, drink and stay calm. Should any one happen to pass by, tell him you are observing a fast for the sake of Rehman, (the Merciful), and hence shall not talk to anyone."

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: She returned to her folks carrying him (the baby). They said, "Oh Mary! What an unprecedented act have you committed!"

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Oh sister of Haroon! Your father was not wicked! Nor was your mother a loose woman!"

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: She pointed towards the infant. They said, "How can we converse with an infant lying in a crib?"

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: The infant said, "I am the servant of Allah! He appointed me His messenger, and granted me the gospel."

31.Dr. Munir Munshey: "He blessed me wherever I might happen to be, and has ordered me to enjoin the ´salat´ and the ´zakat´ as long as I am alive!"

32.Dr. Munir Munshey: "(I am) devoted to my mother, not hapless and arrogant."

33.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Peace upon me the day I was born. The day I shall die. And the day I shall be brought back to life!"

34.Dr. Munir Munshey: Such was Jesus, the son of Mary! This is the real truth about him, which they dispute

35.Dr. Munir Munshey: It is not befitting of Allah to have a son. Exalted is He! Having decided the matter, He merely tells it, "Be!" Hence it becomes

36.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Indeed, Allah is my Lord as well as your Lord! So worship Him. That is the straight path!"

37.Dr. Munir Munshey: Groups have disputed amongst themselves regarding the day (of judgment). Witnessing that great day shall be disastrous for those who deny its coming

38.Dr. Munir Munshey: On the day they shall come to Us, their vision and hearing shall be sharper! Today the evil-doers are clearly lost in their misguidance

39.Dr. Munir Munshey: Warn them of the regretful embarrassment of the day when the matter shall be decided and put to rest! Today they are in heedless and neglectful denial, and they do not believe

40.Dr. Munir Munshey: We shall inherit the earth, including all that is upon it. Towards Us they all shall return

41.Dr. Munir Munshey: And mention Ibraheem in the book; he was a truthful person and a prophet

42.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said to his father, "Oh Father! Why do you worship that which neither sees, nor hears, nor can protect you from anything."

43.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Oh Father, true knowledge did not come to you, but has come to me. So follow me, I shall lead you along the balanced path!"

44.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Oh Father, do not obey Shaitan. Indeed, Shaitan is disobedient to Rehman."

45.Dr. Munir Munshey: "I am worried, Oh Father, that a great torment might fall upon you from Rehman, and that you might end up as a comrade of Shaitan."

46.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said, "Have you turned away from your gods, oh Ibraheem? Desist, for if you do not, I shall stone you to death. Out of my sight, now!"

47.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "Peace be upon you. I shall ask my Lord to forgive you. He is really very kind to me!"

48.Dr. Munir Munshey: "I hereby wash my hands of you, and those you call gods besides Allah. I will worship my Lord! I am confident, If I pray to Him, I shall not be deprived."

49.Dr. Munir Munshey: After he abandoned them along with those whom they called gods beside Allah, We gave him Ishaq and Yaqub. We appointed each of them a prophet

50.Dr. Munir Munshey: We showered Our blessings upon them and gave them high honor

51.Dr. Munir Munshey: And mention Musa in the book. He was really chosen, a prophet and a messenger

52.Dr. Munir Munshey: We called him out from the right side of the mountain Toor, and pulled him close, so as to grant him a private audience

53.Dr. Munir Munshey: And We gave his brother, Haroon, to him as a prophet, a blessing from Us

54.Dr. Munir Munshey: And mention Ismail in the book. Indeed, he was true to his words, a prophet and a messenger

55.Dr. Munir Munshey: He obligated ´salat´ and ´zakat´ upon his family. In the eyes of his Lord, he was an adorable person

56.Dr. Munir Munshey: And in the book, mention Idrees. Indeed, he was a truthful person and a prophet

57.Dr. Munir Munshey: We raised him to an exalted status

58.Dr. Munir Munshey: These are the ones Allah showered His blessings upon. These prophets were the descendants of Adam, and the descendants of those We boarded on the boat with Nooh. They were the descendants of Ibraheem and Ismail. Those were the ones We picked for Our guidance! Such were they that when Our verses were recited to them, they fell prostrate on the ground, tears welling up in their eyes

59.Dr. Munir Munshey: They were succeeded by ignorant ones, those who squandered their "salat´ and followed their whims and the pleasures of the flesh. Their just deserts shall soon catch up with them

60.Dr. Munir Munshey: Except those who repent, believe, and perform good deeds. They will enter paradise. They will not be dealt with unfairly

61.Dr. Munir Munshey: Rehman has promised this paradise to His servants for eternity, in exchange for their belief in the unseen. Surely His promise will be fulfilled

62.Dr. Munir Munshey: In it, they shall hear nothing vulgar; only peace! There, each day and each night, their due portion (sustenance) shall be delivered to them

63.Dr. Munir Munshey: Such is the paradise, which We will allow only Our pious servants to inherit

64.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Angels said), "We descend only when ordered by your Lord. To Him belongs all that lies before us, behind us, and in between. Your Lord is not the One to forget."

65.Dr. Munir Munshey: He is the sustainer of the heavens and the earth, and all else in between. So worship Him in steadfast obedience. Do you know any other comparable to Him

66.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Yet), man says "When I am dead, will I emerge back to life again?"

67.Dr. Munir Munshey: Does man not recall? It was We Who created him earlier, when he was nothing

68.Dr. Munir Munshey: By your Lord! Very definitely! We shall gather them and the Shaitans together. Then, certainly, We shall collect them all around the hellfire, in a manner that they shall be crawling on their knees

69.Dr. Munir Munshey: Thereafter, We shall definitely bring forth from each group of people the one who had been the most ardent and rebellious opponent of Rehman

70.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course, We know very well who amongst them deserves to burn in hell

71.Dr. Munir Munshey: There isn´t any of you who can avoid passing by the hellfire. Your Lord has made this incumbent upon Himself

72.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, We will let the transgressors fall tumbling down into it, but We will rescue those who have been heedful and pious

73.Dr. Munir Munshey: When Our clear lucid verses are recited, those who disbelieve the verses taunt those who believe by saying, "Which of the two of us has a better abode, and enjoys and mingles with better and more distinguished company?"

74.Dr. Munir Munshey: Many groups have We destroyed prior to them. They were better equipped, better furnished and better in appearance

75.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Rehman gives leeway to those who indulge in gross negligence until they get to see that which is promised to be their lot, either the punishment (in this world) or the hour (of judgment)! They would soon realise whose status is lower! Whose allies are weaker

76.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah increases in guidance those who are on the straight path, and the results of their good deeds are better with Allah in terms of rewards and consequences

77.Dr. Munir Munshey: Did you see the one who has chosen to deny Our signs and yet says, "I shall definitely be granted wealth and children?"

78.Dr. Munir Munshey: Has he peeked into the unseen? or has he entered into a contract with Rehman

79.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed not! Rather, We are recording everything he says. We shall extend his punishment a great deal further

80.Dr. Munir Munshey: We shall repossess all that he owns. And We shall bring him out all alone

81.Dr. Munir Munshey: They have taken gods other than Allah, so that they may have supporters

82.Dr. Munir Munshey: No! Indeed, their false gods will disown their worship, and they will become adversaries

83.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do you not notice? We send the Shaitans upon the disbelievers, and they continually incite and instigate them

84.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do not be impatient with them. We are counting down their days

85.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day, We will gather the pious (God-fearing) as guests of Rehman

86.Dr. Munir Munshey: While the sinners will be like thirst-stricken animals, whom We will shove towards the hellfire

87.Dr. Munir Munshey: No one has the ability to intervene, except those whom Rehman has promised

88.Dr. Munir Munshey: What? Do they say Rehman (God) has a son

89.Dr. Munir Munshey: They have surely brought forth a grave thing

90.Dr. Munir Munshey: So grave, indeed, that it may cause the earth to explode into pieces! Or the mountains may come tumbling down! Or the heavens might just crack asunder

91.Dr. Munir Munshey: They have dared to assign a son for Rehman

92.Dr. Munir Munshey: It is not befitting for Rehman to have a son

93.Dr. Munir Munshey: Every being in the heavens and on the earth shall come before Rehman as a slave

94.Dr. Munir Munshey: He is aware of their exact number, and He has counted them all up

95.Dr. Munir Munshey: On the Day of Judgment, each of them shall arrive all alone, and shall be on his own

96.Dr. Munir Munshey: And of course, Rehman will instill with love, the hearts of those who believe and do the righteous deeds

97.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have made this (Quran) easy for you, in your own language, in order that you may give the glad tidings to the pious and the God-fearing. With it, you may warn those that are belligerent

98.Dr. Munir Munshey: Many a people have We destroyed before them. So now, can you sense even a faint sign of their existence, or hear even a wisp of their tale

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Ta, Ha

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have revealed to you this Qur´an, not to cause you distress

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: Rather, it is a memorandum _ (an advisory) _ for the one who fears

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: A communiqué from the Creator of the earth and the celestial heavens

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: Rehman, (the most magnificent), mounted the throne (and governs the universe majestically)

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and on the earth, whatever lies between them, and whatever exists under (the surface of the earth)

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: You call Him out loud. (But remember), He knows even the most intimate thoughts _ thoughts that remain hidden (and unexpressed) forever

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: He is Allah! There is no god but He; His are all the beautiful names

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Is the story of Musa known to you

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: When he spotted a campfire, he said to his family, "I notice a fire! Perhaps, I can bring a live coal from there (to start our own fire), or obtain directions (for the road ahead)."

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: When he approached (the site of) the campfire, We called out to him, "Oh Musa!"

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: It is I, your Lord! Take your shoes off! You happen to be in the holy valley of Toah

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: I chose you! So listen to what is being revealed

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, I am the One _ Allah! There is no god except Me! So obey Me and establish the ´salat´ (prayers) to remember Me

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: In fact, the hour (of Judgment) is sure to arrive! I want to keep (its time) undisclosed, so that every soul may be rewarded in accordance with its efforts

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: Hence, Do not ever let an unbeliever _ the one following his own whims _ dissuade you from it (the belief in the afterlife), lest you perish

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And what is that (you hold) in your right (hand), oh Musa?"

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "It is my stick. I lean on it to rest my weight, and with it I chop off the leaves to feed my cattle. It also has other uses for me."

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "Throw it down, Oh Musa!"

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: So he threw it down, and all of a sudden, it became a snake creeping around (swiftly)

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Allah) said, "Grab it, and do not be afraid. We will change it back to its earlier state."

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: And place your hand in your armpit. (As you pull your hand out) it will appear dazzling white without any discomfort. Another sign

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: To show you (but just two of) Our great signs

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: Go to the pharaoh! He has exceeded (every) limit

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Musa) said, "Lord, unlock my heart!"

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And make my task easy for me."

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And correct my speech impediment."

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: "(So) they understand my words."

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And appoint one of my family members (as an aide) to help me."

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: "My brother, Haroon!"

31.Dr. Munir Munshey: "With him, bolster my strength."

32.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And make him a partner in my mission!"

33.Dr. Munir Munshey: "So, we may glorify You a lot."

34.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And talk about You a lot."

35.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And certainly, You are watching over us."

36.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "You are being granted your requests, oh Musa."

37.Dr. Munir Munshey: We, in fact, conferred favors upon you at other times, too

38.Dr. Munir Munshey: When We inspired your mother by implanting an idea in her mind

39.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Saying) "Put (the child) in a box and push (the box) down the river. It will hurl (the box) ashore, where Our enemy _ his and Mine _ will pick him up." I bestowed love upon you, so you may be raised under My watchful eye

40.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Remember) when your sister walked (along the box) and said to those who found the child, "Shall I guide you to a wet nurse for him?" Thus We sent you back to your mother, to soothe her and to keep her from grieving. Then you killed a man. We rescued you from that distress. We had you go through a terrible ordeal. You lived with the people of Madyan a number of years. And now, you have arrived here at just the right (preordained) time

41.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh Musa, I have selected you specifically for My sake

42.Dr. Munir Munshey: So proceed with My signs, both of you _ you and your brother. Do not become lax in remembering Me

43.Dr. Munir Munshey: Go to the pharaoh! Indeed, he has transgressed

44.Dr. Munir Munshey: But speak to him in an affable manner. Maybe he will heed, and fear (Allah)

45.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "Our Lord! We are afraid that he will let loose his rage upon us and will oppress us."

46.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "Have no fear! I am with you, watching over and listening!"

47.Dr. Munir Munshey: So go to him and say, "We are the messengers of your Lord! Therefore, let the Israelites go with us and do not torture them. We have already brought you the proof from your Lord! Peace is upon him, who follows the guidance."

48.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Indeed, it has been revealed to us that punishment awaits the one who denies and turns away."

49.Dr. Munir Munshey: (The pharaoh) asked, "So then, who is your Lord, oh Musa?"

50.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "The One Who gave each (existing) thing its nature and form, then guided it along."

51.Dr. Munir Munshey: (The pharaoh) asked, "Then, what about the generations of yester years?"

52.Dr. Munir Munshey: Musa said, "The facts about them are known to my Lord and recorded in a book. He neither errs nor forgets."

53.Dr. Munir Munshey: "The same One Who made the earth your (safe) haven, carved roads in it for you, and sent water down from the sky." With that (water), We bring out vegetation of many diverse kinds

54.Dr. Munir Munshey: Eat! And feed your cattle, too. Indeed, in it is a sign for those who (accept) reason

55.Dr. Munir Munshey: We created you from this (very) earth. Into it We shall have you return, and from it We shall bring you out a second time

56.Dr. Munir Munshey: Surely, We had him look at all Our signs, but he rejected (them all) and refused (to believe)

57.Dr. Munir Munshey: (The pharaoh) said, "Are you here to drive us out of our land with your magic, oh Musa?"

58.Dr. Munir Munshey: And added, "Of course, we can perform that kind of magic too. So, go ahead! For our encounter pick a time and place _ a neutral location (accessible to all). We will not fail to show up. Nor should you!"

59.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Musa) said, "Let the coming festival day be the appointed date, and let the people gather at high noon."

60.Dr. Munir Munshey: So, the pharaoh withdrew and with craftiness, put together a scheme, and then he arrived

61.Dr. Munir Munshey: Musa said to them. "Woe unto you! Do not make up lies against Allah. He will annihilate you (all) with a torment. Whoever invents lies against Allah fails."

62.Dr. Munir Munshey: At that point, they began to dispute among themselves and held secret talks

63.Dr. Munir Munshey: At length they said, "These two are just magicians trying to evict you from your land by their spells. They want to deprive you of your exemplary way of life."

64.Dr. Munir Munshey: "So rally all your tricks, then act in unison. Whoever triumphs today will prosper!"

65.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "Oh Musa, either you cast (your spell) first, or else let us be the first to cast (the spell)."

66.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Musa) said, "No! You go first. Then suddenly, because of their spell, it appeared to him that their ropes and sticks (were snakes and) were creeping about swiftly."

67.Dr. Munir Munshey: A sense of fear came over Musa

68.Dr. Munir Munshey: We said, "Do not be afraid. You will be the one to triumph, for sure!"

69.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Throw down the stick in your right hand. It will gobble up the spell they have cast. What they have conjured up is only a trick of the magicians, and magicians never succeed when they come (to face the truth)."

70.Dr. Munir Munshey: The magicians lost out, threw themselves down on the ground prostrate, and said, "We accept the Lord of Haroon and Musa!"

71.Dr. Munir Munshey: The pharaoh said, "You believed him, even though I did not permit you? Obviously, he is your master who has taught you the magic! Now, I will definitely chop off your hands and feet on opposite sides and then crucify you on the trunk of the date-palm tree. You will soon know which one of us awards the severer and the more lasting punishment."

72.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "In the face of the clear signs that have come to us, we will not prefer you to the One Who has created us. So do whatever you decree. Surely, you exercise control (only) in the life of this world."

73.Dr. Munir Munshey: "We have really believed in our Lord! So He may forgive our sins, as well as the magic you compelled us to perform. Allah is better, and the Immortal."

74.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, hell is for the one who comes to his Lord as a criminal. There, he will never die _ nor live

75.Dr. Munir Munshey: The exalted ranks are for those who come to their Lord as believers, having done righteous deeds

76.Dr. Munir Munshey: (As also) the elevated gardens, through which run the rivers. There, they shall live forever! This is the reward for those who endeavor to purify themselves

77.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, We revealed to Musa, "Go and take My servants with you. Strike a dry path through the sea. Do not be frightened of being overtaken (by the Pharaoh in hot pursuit), nor be afraid (of the sea)."

78.Dr. Munir Munshey: The pharaoh pursued them with his army. They were drowned by that which engulfed them from all sides

79.Dr. Munir Munshey: The pharaoh led his nation astray _ did not guide well

80.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh Children of Israel! We rescued you from your enemy, granted you an audience by the right side of the mountain ´Toor´, and sent down the ´munna´ and the ´salwa´ for you

81.Dr. Munir Munshey: Eat the wholesome food We have provided, but do not be overly excessive. Else, My wrath will come down upon you. Surely, the one upon whom lands My fury, comes tumbling down

82.Dr. Munir Munshey: Yet, undoubtedly, I am the One Who grants forgiveness to anyone who repents, believes and acts righteously; and then stays steadfast (till death)

83.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Allah asked), "What made you come (to Me) ahead of your people, oh Musa?"

84.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "They´re coming right behind. I hurried towards You, Lord, so You may be pleased!"

85.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Allah) said, "After you left, We subjected your people to a test. Saamari led them astray."

86.Dr. Munir Munshey: So Musa returned to his nation, angry and aggrieved, and said, "Oh my people, did your Lord not make you excellent promises? Has it been too long for you? Or do you just want the fury of your Lord to land on you? Is that why you broke your pledge with me!"

87.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "We did not willfully opt to break our promise to you. In fact, the burden of carrying people´s jewelry had worn us down. So we unloaded it (into the fire). Likewise, Saamari threw it down, too."

88.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Then, he shaped the gold into the figure of a calf, and it mooed like one! People cried out, "This is your God. The God of Musa. He forgot (to mention it)."

89.Dr. Munir Munshey: Did they not see that it did not respond to them at all? Nor did it have the ability to hurt them, or help them

90.Dr. Munir Munshey: Even though Haroon had told them earlier, "Oh my people! You are being tested with it (the calf). Really, your Lord is the most Merciful. So follow me, all of you! And obey my command!"

91.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "We will not quit worshipping (the calf) until Musa comes back."

92.Dr. Munir Munshey: Musa (when he returned) said, "Oh Haroon, when you saw them going astray, what held you back?"

93.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Why did you not follow me? Did you disobey my instructions?"

94.Dr. Munir Munshey: Haroon said, "Oh son of my mother! Do not tug at my beard, nor pull my hair! I was afraid you would blame me and say ´You caused a split among the Israelites, and did not follow my instruction.´ "

95.Dr. Munir Munshey: Said, "And what about you, Oh Saamari?"

96.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Saamari) said, "I realized what others failed to. So I collected a handful (of dust) from the footmarks of the prophets and tossed it on the calf. That is what my self prompted me to do!"

97.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Musa) said, "Go! This is (the punishment) for you: in this life you will (continually) utter ´Do not touch me´, and you have an appointment (in the afterlife) which you cannot skip. Now watch that god of yours, upon whose worship you insisted. We will surely melt it down, then scatter it around in the ocean."

98.Dr. Munir Munshey: As a matter of fact, Allah (alone) is your God! Besides Him there is no other god, and His knowledge extends over all things

99.Dr. Munir Munshey: Thus, We narrate to you the tales of what went on earlier. We have granted you this (book of) advisement from Ourselves

100.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, those ignoring it shall bear a burdensome punishment on the Day of Judgment

101.Dr. Munir Munshey: They shall forever remain in it _ (that condition of torment). Baneful shall be their burden on the Day of Judgment

102.Dr. Munir Munshey: The day the trumpet sounds will be the day We will gather the criminals, their eyes agape with fright

103.Dr. Munir Munshey: Among themselves they will whisper, "You stayed (on the earth) only ten days!"

104.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course We know very well what they shall say. The most accurate among them will say, "You stayed there for just a day!"

105.Dr. Munir Munshey: They are asking you about the mountains. Tell them, "My Lord will blow them up into fine dust."

106.Dr. Munir Munshey: He will turn (this earth) into a plain wasteland

107.Dr. Munir Munshey: You will not find any ridges or cracks on it

108.Dr. Munir Munshey: On that day, they will (meekly) respond to the convener _ (the angel) _ who shall face no hindrance. In the presence of Rehman, voices will drop to a subdued hush. You shall hear nothing but faint whispers

109.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day, mediation shall benefit no one, unless Rehman grants permission, and about whom He pleases to hear (favorable) remarks

110.Dr. Munir Munshey: He knows all that lies ahead of them as well as everything about their past. Others do not know at all

111.Dr. Munir Munshey: All heads will bow before the Eternally Alive and the Ever-lasting. Anyone carrying a burden of having committed an injustice shall fail miserably

112.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Whereas) those who had acted righteously _ provided they had believed _ shall have no fear of being wronged or short changed

113.Dr. Munir Munshey: Thus, We revealed this Qur´an in Arabic. In it We have defined sharply the promises and the threats. Maybe they will fear (Allah), or it _ (the Qur´an) _ will bring back the remembrance (of Allah)

114.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah, the Genuine Emperor, is the most Exalted! Do not be in a hurry to repeat (the fresh verses of) the Qur´an before the revelations conclude. Say, "Lord, enhance me in knowledge!"

115.Dr. Munir Munshey: Earlier, We had entrusted Adam with a task, but his memory lapsed. We did not find in him the firmness of resolve

116.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Remember)! We said to the angels, "Fall down prostrate before Adam!" And they all fell prostrate, except Iblees (Shaitan). He refused

117.Dr. Munir Munshey: So We said, "Oh Adam, that one, surely, is your and your wife´s enemy. Now do not let him drive you out of paradise, lest you feel distressed."

118.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course, here (in paradise), it is your (privilege) that you do not go hungry, nor are you unclad

119.Dr. Munir Munshey: And here you are not thirsty, troubled by the (sultry sweltering) sun

120.Dr. Munir Munshey: Yet Shaitan whispered (and aroused) doubts in his mind saying, "Oh Adam, shall I show you the tree of immortality, and the domain that has no demise?"

121.Dr. Munir Munshey: Both of them _ (Adam and his wife) _ ate its fruit and their genitalia became visible to them. With the leaves of the Garden of Eden they began to cover themselves. Adam disobeyed his Lord and went astray

122.Dr. Munir Munshey: Later, his Lord favored him, granted him forgiveness and guided him

123.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Allah) said, "Get down from here! Both of you _ (Adam and Shaitan)! You are each other´s enemy. Whoever follows the guidance _ when the guidance from Me arrives _ will not go astray, and will not be miserable."

124.Dr. Munir Munshey: While a wretched (unwholesome) livelihood will be the lot of the one who turns away from My advice and warning. He will be blind when We round him up on the Day of Judgment

125.Dr. Munir Munshey: He shall say, "Lord, why did You raise me blind? I used to be endowed with eyesight?"

126.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah will say, "Much the same as you ignored My signs when they came to you! Befittingly, today you are being ignored."

127.Dr. Munir Munshey: This is how We chastise the one who exceeds the bounds, and ignores the signs of his Lord. The punishment of the afterlife is far worse and ever persisting

128.Dr. Munir Munshey: Many towns have We destroyed before them. Did that fact not teach them? They walk through those ruins! There are surely signs in it for those with intellect

129.Dr. Munir Munshey: The word of your Lord has been proclaimed! Had it not been, and if it wasn´t essential and for a specific period, (then their doom and demise would be instant)

130.Dr. Munir Munshey: Therefore, with patience bear their remarks and chant the praises of your Lord before the sun rises, before it sets, and during the night. Glorify Him in the morning and evening. Perhaps you will feel contented

131.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do not look (enviously) at the splendors of this life with which We have furnished some of their groups. It is (merely) to test them. The grants of your Lord (in the afterlife) are far better and ever lasting

132.Dr. Munir Munshey: Bid your family to observe the ´salat´, and stay steadfast upon it yourself. We do not seek sustenance from you. Indeed, We bestow sustenance. The final outcome hinges on piety

133.Dr. Munir Munshey: They say, "Why did he not bring us a sign?" Did clear proofs _ those narrated in the earlier scriptures _ not reach them

134.Dr. Munir Munshey: Had We, prior to sending him (Muhammad, SAW), ruined them with a disaster, they would have complained, "Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your signs instead of being disgraced and humiliated."

135.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Each (soul) is in a state of waiting. You wait, too! Soon you will find out who is on the right path, and well-guided."

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Their reckoning has drawn closer, but people are turning away in unmindful ignorance

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: When a fresh narrative from their Lord reaches them, they (barely) hear it, then they resume their pastimes

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: Their minds absorbed in pleasures, the evil doers whisper under their breaths, "Isn´t he just a human being like you all? Will you then, succumb to his magic knowingly?"

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: The messenger said, "My Lord knows everything uttered in the heavens and on earth. He is the All-hearing and the All-knowing."

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: And they said, "Vague meaningless dreams, or he has made it up, or he is a poet. Else, let him present to us a miracle like the earlier (messengers) did."

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Those towns _ the ones We destroyed in the past _ had also failed to believe. So now, will they believe

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have always commissioned men (as messengers) and sent revelations to them, even before your time. Should you not know (this fact), ask the people of the scriptures

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: We did not fashion their physiques, so as to enable them to live without food, nor did they live forever

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, We fulfilled Our pledge and rescued them, and those whom We wished. We destroyed those who had exceeded their limits

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have sent you this book. In it are narrations about your own self. So why do you not understand

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: Many towns have We dashed into fragments. They were evil! Then We brought other nations in their place

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: When they experienced Our power, they suddenly began to flee

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Do not run away! Return to your homes and the luxurious comforts you were given. You will be called (to account)."

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "Misery to us! We surely were evil!"

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: They kept saying that right until We turned them into the plucked out harvest

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything in between as an amusement (and a pastime)

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: Had We wanted just to have fun, and if We were (given to) doing that, We would have done so all by Ourselves

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: On the contrary, We run the truth against falsehood, over which it triumphs. In time, the falsehood is bound to come to naught! Misery to you for what you attribute

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: Every living being in the heavens and on earth belongs to Him, and no one in His presence _ either out of pride or regret _ shies away from worshipping Him

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: All day and all night, they chant His praises. They do not relent
