12.Dr. Munir Munshey: He will forgive your sins, and usher you into the paradise, right through which run the rivers. (And He will admit you) into the excellent abodes in the eternal paradise of Eden. That is really the greatest triumph

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: As for that other thing you love, _ Allah´s help and victory in the near future _ give the believers the good news (of that victory)

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh you who believe! Become the helper of Allah, like the disciples of Jesus, the son of Mary. He asked his disciples, "Who will help me for (the sake of) Allah?" They replied, "We are the helpers of Allah!" A group of the Israelites believed him, and another group rejected. Then, We assisted the believers against their enemies, so the believers prevailed

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Everything in the heavens and on earth chants His praises! (He is) the King, the Holy, the Almighty and the Wisest

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: He it is, Who raised in an unlettered nation a messenger in their midst, the one who recites to them His verses, cleanses and purifies them, and teaches them the book and the wisdom. Prior to that, they were clearly lost and astray

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Muhammad, SAW is the messenger) also for others who have not yet joined the believers; and He (Allah) is the most Powerful and the Wisest

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: It is the blessing of Allah! He bestows it upon whom He wills. Allah is the Lord of the greatest honor

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: Those who were entrusted with the burden of the Torah but failed to bear its obligations, are actually like a jackass carrying a load of books. Worse (in fact) is the example of a nation who rejects the signs of Allah; and Allah does not guide the nation of evil doers

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Oh you who became Jews, if you claim to be the friends of Allah, a people chosen (by Him) over all other nations, then wish for death if you are really truthful

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: They will never ever wish for death, because of what their own hands have wrought and sent forth. Allah knows the evil doers very well

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Indeed, the death you flee from shall definitely come to you. Then, you would be presented before the One Who knows the unseen and the manifest; and He will tell you everything you have been doing!"

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh you who believe! On Friday, when the call sounds for the (congregational) prayers, rush towards it and halt all trade (and business) activity. That is better for you, if you only knew

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: And spread out in the land. once the prayer concludes. Seek the bounties of Allah and remember Allah a lot, so that you would achieve success

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: When they see a bargain or an amusement troupe, they rush towards it and leave you standing. Say, "That, which is with Allah is better than any bargain or amusement. He is absolutely the very Best of all the providers!"

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Oh prophet), when the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We bear witness that you really are the messenger of Allah." Of course, Allah knows you are His messenger; (but) Allah affirms that the hypocrites are really the liars

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: They use their oaths as a pretext to dissuade (and deter others) from the path of Allah. What they do is indeed evil

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: This is so because they believed (at first), and then went back to disbelieving. (Now), their hearts have been sealed and they do not comprehend

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Oh prophet), the appearance of the hypocrites and their physiques are pleasing to look at. Their speech is so glib and pleasant, one likes to just keep on listening. It is as if they were carved out of wood and propped up (against the wall). They think (like cowards), that every call to action is against them. They are the enemies! Beware of them! May Allah curse them. How perverted are they

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: When it is said to them, "Come! The messenger of Allah will seek forgiveness for you", they turn their heads away. You find them looking away in arrogance (and disdain)

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: It makes no difference whether you seek forgiveness for them or not. Allah will never forgive them. Indeed Allah never guides the nation of evildoers

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: They are the ones who say, "Do not spend anything on the companions of Allah´s messenger. (Wait) till they desert him." (All) the treasures of the heavens and the earth belong to Allah. But the hypocrites do not understand

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: They (the hypocrites) say, "When we return to town, the one with respect and honor will expel the despised (and humbled)." The respect and honor belong (entirely) to Allah, His messenger, and the believers. But the hypocrites do not know

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh those of you who believe! Do not let your wealth and your children divert you away from the remembrance of Allah. Anyone doing that would indeed be the loser

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: Spend (in charity), out of what We have granted you, lest death comes to any of you and (remorsefully) he says, "My Lord, if only you grant me an extension, (a little more time), I would give (my wealth in) charity; and I would be righteous!"

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah never extends (the life) for anyone, past his time. Allah is well Aware of what you do

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Everything in the heavens and on earth chants the praises of Allah. To him belongs the empire! To him belongs all praise (and all gratitude)! He has power over all things

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: It is He Who created you. (Yet), among you are those who deny (the truth); and some of you believe. Allah watches everything you do

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: He created the heavens and the earth (based) on the truth. He gave you form, the most excellent (the best possible) form; and towards Him is your journey back

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: He knows everything in the heavens and on earth. He knows what you conceal, and what you declare. He has full knowledge of everything _ (all the emotions, intentions and thoughts) _ that exists in the hearts

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: Have you not heard the tales of those who denied earlier? They tasted the evil consequences of their conduct. There is, (in addition), a painful punishment (in store) for them

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah´s messengers came to them with clear proofs. Yet, they (denied and) said, "Will (fallible) humans guide us now?" They rejected and turned away. Allah (in His Own right) is Free from all needs, and is Worthy of all praise

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: The unbelievers claim they will never be brought back to life (for reckoning). Say, "Of course you will! My Lord will definitely raise you (back to life). Then, He will certainly tell you what you had done. That is (really) easy for Allah to do."

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: Therefore, believe in Allah and His messenger; and the light (of revelation) which We have sent down. Allah is well Aware of what you do

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: The day of gathering _ that day when He will gather all of you together _ will be the day of loss and gain, (the day of reparation and redress of wrongful deeds). He (Allah) will remove (and cleanse) the shortcomings (and sins) of the one who believes in Allah, and does righteous acts. He will admit such a person into paradise to live forever; rivers run right through it. That is the greatest success

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: (While) those who disbelieve and deny Our signs, shall really be the companions of fire. They will live there forever! It is a despicable destination

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: Unless it is with the (will and) permission of Allah, no calamity can ever strike (anyone). Allah guides (and soothes) the heart of the one who believes in Him. Allah is well-Aware of every single thing

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: Obey Allah, and obey His messenger! (Bear this in mind) if you turn away, (that the responsibility) upon our messenger is (nothing more than) to convey the message clearly and plainly

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah! There is no god except He! The believers should place their trust in Allah

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh those of you who believe! Your enemies are (likely to be) among your spouses and your children. Beware of them! If you forego, forbear and forgive, (you will find that) Allah is indeed the most Forgiving and the most Merciful

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: In reality, your wealth and your children are a trial (for you). There exists with Allah, a tremendous tribute (at the end of the trial)

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Practice righteousness and restraint), and fear Allah as much as you can. Listen and obey, and give charity. It is for your own good. The successful ones are really those who escape the greed within their own selves

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: If you advance Allah a sincere loan, He will multiply it and return it to you twofold; and (in addition) He will grant you forgiveness. Allah is the most Forbearing; He appreciates (and rewards) gratitude

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: (He is) the Knower of the unseen and the manifest, the Almighty, the Wisest

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh prophet, (and Oh you believers)! If you (must) divorce your women, divorce them for a (prescribed) period. Count the period (correctly). Fear Allah, your Lord, and do not _ unless they have committed a flagrantly immoral act _ expel your divorced women out of their homes. The women too should not leave their homes. These are the confines of Allah. Anyone overstepping the limits of Allah actually commits an outrage upon himself. You do not know! (During that period), Allah may well bring about something (to cause reconciliation between the husband and wife)

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: At the end of the (prescribed) period, either hold back your women (in wedlock) lawfully, according to the well-known (prescribed) manner, or make the divorce final in accordance with the well known (prescribed) way. Take two of your fair minded (and respected) men as your witnesses. (Oh witnesses)! Bear the witness truthfully for the sake of Allah! Those who believe in Allah, and the life-to-come, are hereby being asked to heed. Allah will provide a way out for the one who fears Him

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: And, He would grant the bounties (and provisions) from sources they had not expected (or even imagined). Allah is sufficient for anyone who places his trust in Him. (Always, and without an exception), Allah brings His decrees to destiny. Indeed, Allah it is Who has appointed the destiny for every single thing

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Remember), if you are in doubt about the ´iddat.´ of your women, _ either because they are past the age, or haven´t yet started to menstruate _ it lasts three months. The ´iddat´ for the pregnant women (is three months, or it) lasts till the termination of pregnancy. (iddat: the period after divorce during which a woman is forbidden to remarry). Allah (grants a leeway and) makes matters easy for the one who fears Him

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: This is the commandment of Allah; He has revealed it to you. Whoever fears Him (and practices righteousness and restraint), Allah will cleanse him of his sins (and rid him of his faults and flaws); and Allah will magnify his rewards

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: (During the period of ´iddat´) have the (divorced) women live where you live, as your resources allow. Do not abuse and mistreat them, in order to harass them. If they happen to be carrying (your) child, then spend and bear their expenses till they carry their pregnancies to term. If they are nursing (your child), then compensate them in a fair and equitable manner. Settle the issue (of compensation) between you and your (former) wives amicably. Should the matter (of compensation) be difficult (and hard to resolve), then any other woman may nurse the child

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: Let the well-to-do spend according to his means, and let the one with limited resources spend according to what Allah has granted him. Never does Allah obligate anyone in excess of what He has granted him. Allah may soon change the difficult circumstances into (leisure and) comfort

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: So many communities (in the past) have been insolent and arrogant towards the commandments of their Lord, and His messengers. So, very harshly We called them to account. We inflicted upon them a severe punishment

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: They tasted the evil consequences of their conduct. The final outcome of their conduct was (nothing but) sheer loss

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: For them, Allah has prepared the severest (most awful) punishment. So fear Allah, oh you endowed with reason and intellect; and (oh) those (of you) who believe! Allah has sent you a reminder (and an admonition)

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: A messenger recites for you the clear and unambiguous verses of Allah! So that he, (the messenger), may bring out of darkness into light, those who believe and act righteously. Allah will usher into paradise _ rivers run right through it _ anyone who believes in Him and performs righteous deeds. There, he will live forever and ever. (There), Allah has (kept in store) excellent (and everlasting) bounties for him

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah has created the seven heavens. And the same goes for the earth! The commands (of Allah) prevail over all of them (constantly). So that you may know (for sure), that Allah is capable of doing everything; and that Allah has (full and unabridged) knowledge of every single thing

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh prophet! Why did you, in order to please your wives, forbid yourself that which Allah has deemed lawful for you? Allah is all-Forgiving, the most Merciful

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: Allah has prescribed a procedure for you to expiate (and rescind) such oaths. Allah is your Patron; He is the most Knowledgeable, the Wisest

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Remember)! The prophet confided in one of his wives concerning a certain matter. When she divulged (the information) to another one (of his wives), Allah informed the prophet about it. The prophet told his wife a portion (of what Allah had informed him) and ignored the rest. When he told her about it, she asked, "Who told you about this?" He replied, "The One Who knows all and is the most Aware has told me!"

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Oh wives of the prophet), the two of you better turn to Allah and repent. Your hearts have wandered off the right path. But if you back each other against the prophet, then (beware)! Allah is certainly his friend! And so are the angel Gibraeel, and all the righteous believers. Besides that, all the angels are his supporters

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: In case the prophet divorces you all, his Lord would perhaps grant him other wives _ widows or maidens, in your place. They would be better than you, more obedient, believing, pious, penitent and fond of fasting

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh you who believe, save yourselves and your families from the fire. Humans and stones are its fuel! Burly and rigidly fierce angels are (appointed as guards) over it. They do not disobey or disregard any of the commands of Allah. (Rather), they (diligently) carry out whatever they are commanded

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh you unbelievers! Do not make excuses today. You are being punished only for what you have (actually) done (and nothing else)

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh you believers! Turn to Allah in repentance, an earnest (and heartfelt) repentance. Allah, your Lord, may just rid you of your sins (and your faults and flaws); He will usher you into paradise, through which run the rivers. Allah will not let the prophet and those who believe in him, be humiliated on that day. The light (emanating from them) would run in front of, and to the right of them. They shall call out, "Our Lord, (please) complete for us our light, and forgive us. Indeed, You have power over all things!"

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh prophet! Wage a relentless struggle against the unbelievers, and the hypocrites. Be stern against them (and do not yield). Hell shall be their abode! What an evil (despicable) destination

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: For the unbelievers, Allah cites the case of the wives of the prophets ´Nooh´ and ´Loot´. They were married to two of Our most honorable and righteous servants. But they betrayed their husbands, and so their husbands could not help them against Allah at all. Both of these women were ordered to enter the hellfire just like all the others who (deserved to enter hell, and) would live there for ever

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: And for the believers. Allah cites the example of the pharaoh´s wife. She said, "Lord, (please) build me a house in paradise under your (auspicious) care. Save me from the pharaoh and his (evil) deeds, and save me from (such) an unjust nation."

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: (And the example of) Mary, a daughter Imran, who had (rigidly) guarded her chastity. We breathed Our spirit into her. Thus, she gave credence (and bore witness) to the words of her Lord and His scriptures. She was (truly) among the obedient ones

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Blessed is the One Who holds in his hand the kingdom (of the heavens and the earth). He is capable of accomplishing everything

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Blessed is) the One Who created the death and life, so He may try and test you; which of you performs the better deeds. He is the most Powerful, and the most Kind

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: The One Who created seven tiers of heavens, one atop another! You do not find any disparity or disharmony in the creation of Rehman, (the most Merciful). Cast another look! Do you find any breach (in the heavens)

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Go ahead)! Look again and again. Your eyes would wear out, and your sight would (wander and) return to you, bewildered and in vain

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have embellished the heaven nearest to this world with (numerous) lamps (the stars). We have made this heaven (a means) to bombard the Shaitan with missiles, to drive them away. For them, We have prepared a punishment by the blazing fire

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: There exists a punishment of hell for those who refuse to believe in their Lord. Theirs is a despicable destination

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: As they are hurled into hell, they would hear it shriek and scream (in anger); it would boil over furiously, as it blazes

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: It would almost explode in its frenzied fury. As a fresh crop (of sinners) is flung into hell, its warden would ask, "(How did you end up here)? Hadn´t a warner come to you?"

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: They would reply, "Yes! A warner had indeed come to us, but (alas)! We rejected him and said: "Allah has revealed nothing! You have just (blundered and) slumped into a grave error."

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: They would say, "Had we listened (attentively), or applied our mind, we would have escaped being the inmates of the blazing fire!"

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: Thus, they would confess their sins; damned are the inmates of the fiery flames

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: Forgiveness and a rich reward exists for those who fear their Lord, though they do not see Him

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Little does it matter whether you) whisper your words in secret, or shout them out aloud! He is indeed aware of everything, (every thought) that passes through the heart

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: Why would He not know? He is the Creator! He is the all-Knowing, well Aware of every subtle detail

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: He it is, Who subdued the earth for you (and made it a comfortable and controllable habitat). So move along its surface and eat the food provided by Him. But (remember), towards Him is your (revival and) resurrection

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: Are you unafraid that He, the One in heavens (Allah), will not let the earth swallow you? That it will not suddenly begin to rock (as in an earthquake)

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: Are you unafraid that He _the One in heaven, (Allah) _will not unleash a violent hurricane upon you? Then you would learn in a hurry how (true and terrible) was My warning

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course, (most of) their predecessors had (also) refused to believe. So (observe), how (devastating) was My wrath (and punishment)

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do they not look at the birds above them? They flap and fold their wings (and fly)! No one but Rehman, (the Merciful), holds them up (in mid air). Indeed He is the One watching over every single thing

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do you have an army that can support you against the Merciful (Lord)? In fact, the unbelievers are just duped by a delusion

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: If He withholds His bounties from you, do you have anyone else who could grant you the provisions? The fact is, they hide behind their pride, and their (irrational) aversion (to the truth)

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: So who (do you think) is better guided? The one crawling on his face groping (to find his way), or the one walking upright along the straight path?"

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "It is He Who brought you into being, and conferred upon you (the faculties of) hearing, sight and reasoning. Seldom do you express gratitude!"

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "It is He Who has spread you across the earth; and (in the end) you would be summoned back to Him."

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: They say, "When will that promise come to be, if you are truthful?"

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "That knowledge lies solely with Allah; in fact I am simply a warner!"

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: Actually, the faces of the unbelievers would distort (with horror) when they witness the torment in close proximity. They would be told "(this is the promise), this is what you had called for."

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Have you thought it over? Regardless of whether Allah destroys me and my companions, or shows us His mercy, (the question before you should be) who will shelter the unbelievers from the painful punishment?"

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "He is Rehman, (the most Merciful). We believe in Him! And in Him we trust. Very soon, you will find out who has committed the obvious (and the gravest) blunder?"

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "Have you thought it over? Should (all) your (drinking) water sink underground (and disappear), who can supply you with springs and clean running water (to drink)?"

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Nun! (Allah swears by) the pen and whatever they, (the angels), write

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Oh prophet), you are not, by the grace of your Lord, a mad man

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: In fact, you certainly have a perpetual and ever lasting reward (with your Lord)

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, you certainly bear the highest moral character

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: Soon you will see, and so shall they

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Who is deranged _ (you or they)

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, your Lord knows well who has strayed from His path; and He (also) knows those who are the rightly guided

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do not yield to those who have denied the truth

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: They would love it if you make concessions (and compromise the truth somewhat). They too, would then give in (some)

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: And do not obey the contemptible oath-monger

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: The abusive mudslinger, who throws insults around (all the time)

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: The one who prohibits the good, trespasses and defiantly indulges in sinful acts

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: Ignoble and greedy, in short, despised

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: (He acts that way), because he is wealthy and has (many) children

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: When Our verses are recited to him, he remarks, "(Legends)! Tales of the earlier folks!"

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: Very soon, We will (burn and) brand his snout

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, We have put them through a test, just as We tested the owners of an orchard. They swore to pick its fruit the next morning

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: They allowed no exception, (They did not say, "If Allah pleases")

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: So, while they slept, a calamity from their Lord visited that orchard (and destroyed it completely)

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: By the morning, it looked bare, as if it had already been picked clean

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: At daybreak they called each other

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Proceed to your field early in the morning, if you want to pick the fruit (today)."

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: So they departed, muttering to each other

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Today, do not let the poor and the needy enter the orchard and pester you (for alms)."

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: With that resolve, and certain (in their minds) that they had the means (to harvest), they left in the morning

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: When they saw their orchard, they (failed to recognize it, and) cried out, "We have surely lost our way."

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: "No! Rather, we have been deprived!"

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: The moderate one among them said, "Did I not tell you? Why did you not chant (your Lord´s) praises?"

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "Exalted is our Lord. In fact, we were the wrongdoers!"

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then they turned around, and began blaming each other

31.Dr. Munir Munshey: They said, "Indeed, we had certainly acted arrogantly."

32.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Hopefully, our Lord will grant us something better in its place. Of course, we do turn to our Lord for forgiveness."

33.Dr. Munir Munshey: Such is the punishment (in this life), but the torment of the afterlife is far greater, if they only knew

34.Dr. Munir Munshey: For the righteous, there exist with their Lord the blessings filled gardens

35.Dr. Munir Munshey: Are We to treat the obedient ones the same as the criminals

36.Dr. Munir Munshey: What is wrong with you? How do you draw your conclusions

37.Dr. Munir Munshey: Or did you learn it from your scriptures

38.Dr. Munir Munshey: That you shall have whatever you prefer

39.Dr. Munir Munshey: Or, do you hold a binding contract over Us till the day of Resurrection, (guaranteeing) that whatever you order shall be yours

40.Dr. Munir Munshey: Ask them. Who amongst them can claim that

41.Dr. Munir Munshey: Or, do they have (other gods as Allah´s) partners (offering them such a guarantee)? Let them produce these partners if they are truthful

42.Dr. Munir Munshey: They would be asked to prostrate (before Allah) on that day when the reality is laid bare. But (that day), they shall find themselves unable (to prostrate)

43.Dr. Munir Munshey: Downcast would be their eyes (in shame); disgrace shall overwhelm them. They were asked to prostrate in this life, when they were sound and solid

44.Dr. Munir Munshey: So let Me handle (all) those who reject this Qur´an. Gradually, We would lead them (into Hell), by means they would seldom perceive

45.Dr. Munir Munshey: I will let them have a little respite. My scheme is a cinch _ (airtight and foolproof)

46.Dr. Munir Munshey: Or, do you ask them for a fee (or a reward)? Are they laboring under the burden (of such a demand)

47.Dr. Munir Munshey: Or, do they have the knowledge of the unseen so they may write (their own fate)

48.Dr. Munir Munshey: So, wait patiently for your Lord´s decree. Do not act like the man of the fish, (the prophet Jonah), when he called (his Lord), choked with grief

49.Dr. Munir Munshey: (In the fish he would still be), had the mercy of your Lord not reached him. He was tossed on the bare (and barren) beach _ censured (and chastised)

50.Dr. Munir Munshey: Eventually, his Lord chose him and placed him among the righteous ones

51.Dr. Munir Munshey: The unbelievers look at you with aversion (and animosity), and they almost trip you up with their eyes. They hear this reminder, the Qur´an, and say, "He is really a man possessed."

52.Dr. Munir Munshey: Although it is (nothing but) a reminder for the whole world

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: The Reality

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: And what is (that inevitable) Reality

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: What do you understand by the ´Reality´

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: The ´Samoods´ and the ´Aads´ denied the (impending) calamity of sudden onset _ (the hour of Judgment)

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: So the Samoods were wiped out by the lightning (and the thunderbolt)

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: While the ´Aads´ were destroyed by the violent howling winds

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: For seven hideous days and eight gruesome nights, He let the winds ravage them. (Had you been there), you could see their bodies tossed about (and strewn around), as if they were the hollowed out trunks of the date trees

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do you see any of them around, anymore

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: The pharaoh, and those before him _ the overturned cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah) _ committed the (very same) crime

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: They defied the messengers of their Lord, and so He seized (and squeezed) them into a tight grip

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, (oh believers, during the great deluge of Nooh) when the water began to inundate, We carried you (and kept you afloat) aboard a ship

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: So as to make it a memorable event for you; so that the attentive souls may retain an indelible memory of that event in their (subconscious) mind

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: As (soon as) the trumpet sounds for the first time

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: The earth and the mountains would be dislodged and crushed with a single blow

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: And so, on that day the inevitable (event) would come to pass

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: Feeble and frail, on that day the sky shall burst asunder

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: The angels would be present there, at the edge (of the throne). Eight of them would carry your Lord´s throne above them

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: That shall be the day you are presented before Him (with all your secrets bared); none of your intimate secrets shall remain unexposed

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, the one who is given his record (of deeds) in his right hand would say, (excitedly to others), "Here, take (a look)! Read the record (of my deeds)."

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: "I really did believe that (one day), I would have to face the reckoning."

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: So, he shall have a pleasant and blissful (ever lasting) life

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: In the exalted (gardens of delight)

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: With its cluster of fruit (drooping low), within easy reach

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Enjoy)! Eat and drink (and relish your reward), the result of the deeds you had earned in the life gone by

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: While he, who is given his record (of deeds) in his left hand would (lament and) say, "I wish I had never been given my record."

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: "I wish I had never known (the contents of) my record."

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: "I wish my death (in the world) had been final (and decisive)."

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: "My wealth (and possessions) did not help me."

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And my (talents and) faculties have (waned and) gone."

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: (The command will sound), "Grab him and tie him down!"

31.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And roast him over the blazing fire."

32.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Then shackle him securely with iron chains, seventy yards long."

33.Dr. Munir Munshey: He did not believe in Allah, the Almighty, the Greatest

34.Dr. Munir Munshey: Nor did he ever encourage the feeding of the needy (and the hungry)

35.Dr. Munir Munshey: Today, he has no friends here

36.Dr. Munir Munshey: And to eat, he only has the filthy discharge from wounds

37.Dr. Munir Munshey: Which no one except the sinners have to eat

38.Dr. Munir Munshey: No! Absolutely not! I swear by all that you see

39.Dr. Munir Munshey: As well as that which you do not

40.Dr. Munir Munshey: It, (the Qur´an), is the word of the noble messenger

41.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Certainly)! it is not the word of a poet. Little do you believe

42.Dr. Munir Munshey: Nor is it the word of a fortuneteller. Seldom do you ponder

43.Dr. Munir Munshey: It is the revelation from the Lord of the universe

44.Dr. Munir Munshey: Had he (the prophet) purported (and fabricated) lies about Us

45.Dr. Munir Munshey: We would have seized him by his right hand

46.Dr. Munir Munshey: And would have cut off his main vein

47.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Absolutely) no one among you could have kept Us away from him

48.Dr. Munir Munshey: It is certainly a reminder for the righteous

49.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course We know, that among you are those who disbelieve

50.Dr. Munir Munshey: Thus, this Qur´an will definitely be the source of anguish for the disbelievers

51.Dr. Munir Munshey: It is the veritable truth _ (a statement of absolute certainty)

52.Dr. Munir Munshey: So glorify the name of the Almighty, your Lord

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: The skeptics ask about the torment that is bound to land

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: Upon the unbelievers! Nothing can ward it off

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: (It is) from Allah, the Lord of the means of ascent (to the heavens)

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: The angels and the spirits rise up towards Him during a day that spans fifty thousand years

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: So endure (all adversity) with grace and patience

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, they consider the punishment to be far in the future

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: While We see it close at hand

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: The sky that day, will be like molten copper

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: And the mountains like the fluffy tufts of wool

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: Even the closest friends would fail to inquire about (the welfare of) their close friends

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: Although, they would see each other! The criminal, that day, would like to escape punishment by offering his own son as ransom

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: His wife and his brother

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: And (all) relatives _ (even those) who had sheltered him (through the years)

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: In fact, (he would be ready to offer as ransom) every single soul on earth, if he could (in return) save himself

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: No! Of course not! It is a blazing inferno

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: And it will scald away the scalps (of the unbelievers)

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: It will summon (by name), all those who turned their backs and ran away (from the truth)

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: And amassed (wealth), and hoarded it

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, man is created impatient (and fretful)

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: He (frets and) panics in the face of adversity

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: And acts niggardly when he encounters good fortune

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: Except those who perform ´salat´

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Successful are) those who are steadfast (prompt, and punctual) in their ´salat´

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: Those who accept a due share in their wealth

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: For people seeking (alms), and for the deprived

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Successful are) those who believe in the Day of Judgment

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: Those who were fearful of the torment inflicted by their Lord

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, None may feel (wholly) secure and indifferent to the torment of their Lord

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Successful are) those who rein in their sexuality

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: Except with their spouses _ those whom their right hands possess; because then, they are not blameworthy

31.Dr. Munir Munshey: While those seeking anything beyond that are really the transgressors

32.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Successful are) those who discharged their trusts faithfully, and honor their pledges

33.Dr. Munir Munshey: And when they bear witness, they stand firm (and are truthful)

34.Dr. Munir Munshey: Those who perform their ´salat´ devotedly and diligently

35.Dr. Munir Munshey: Such (righteous) ones would be honored in paradise

36.Dr. Munir Munshey: So what is wrong with the unbelievers? Why do they run towards you

37.Dr. Munir Munshey: (They are ever so ready to denounce you) in groups, on the right and on the left

38.Dr. Munir Munshey: Does every man among them aspire to enter the blessings filled paradise

39.Dr. Munir Munshey: No, of course not! We have created them out of (base) matter that they know (and are familiar with)

40.Dr. Munir Munshey: Certainly not! I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests, that We are indeed capable

41.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of replacing them with (other creations) better than them. We shall certainly not be surpassed

42.Dr. Munir Munshey: So let them stay engrossed in their idle talks and their games, until they come to face their promised day

43.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day they would rush out of their graves fast, as if they were hurrying towards their goal

44.Dr. Munir Munshey: Their eyes shall be down cast (with shame). Humiliation and disgrace shall overwhelm them (completely). They are being promised (just) such a day

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, We sent Nooh towards his people (and said to him), "Warn your people before (it is too late, and) a painful punishment befalls them."

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said, "Oh my people, I am obviously a messenger towards you!"

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: "(With a message) that you should worship Allah (exclusively); you should fear Him, and obey me."

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: "He will forgive your sins and grant you respite for a specified time. Indeed, once that time arrives, the decree of Allah cannot be delayed. If you only knew!"

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: He said, "My Lord, I have invited my nation (towards the truth) day and night."

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: "But my calls have only increased their hatred (for the truth)."

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: "In fact, whenever I call them (to say) that You might forgive them, they stick their fingers in their ears. They (hide their faces and) wrap their clothes around them (in defiance). They grew obstinate and became (rude and insulting, and) increasingly arrogant."

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Indeed, I even preached to them in public."

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Indeed, I (not only) declared (and conveyed the message) to them in public, (but) I even reasoned with them in private."

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: "I said, ´seek forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Oft-Forgiving!´"

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: "He will send abundant rain for you from the sky."

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: "He will help you and cause you to increase in wealth and offspring. He will grant you gardens. He will cause rivers to flow (in your land)."

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: "What is the matter with you? Why do you not expect (and anticipate) dignity from Allah?"

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: "He has created you in stages."

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Do you not see how Allah has created the seven heavens in tiers."

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: "In the heavens, He created the moon to be (a soft) light, (while) He set the sun up as a lamp _ (a source of light)."

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: "It is Allah Who (created you from the earth´s elements; as it were, He) caused you to sprout from the earth (as plants)."

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Later, He will return you to earth, and then He will bring you (back to life) out (of this very earth)."

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Allah has laid the earth out for you as a wide expanse."

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: "So you move about in this world, over highways and mountain passes."

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: Nooh said, "My Lord, they have really disobeyed me; they have followed the ones whose wealth and offspring have merely served to (multiply and) increase their loss."

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: "They have hatched a mighty awesome scheme."

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: "They said (to their followers), ´Do not ever give up your gods. Never ever abandon (the worship of) Wada, Suwa, Yaguth, and nasr´ _(all names of idols being worshipped)."

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: "These idols have led many astray. (Surely), You let (no one but) the evil doers increase (and advance) in misguidance."

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: Because of their sins, they were drowned and then cast into the fire. They did not find any helpers to save them from Allah

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: Nooh prayed, "My Lord, do not leave any one of them (alive) on (the surface of) the earth."

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Indeed, if You spare them, they may lead Your servants astray. They will beget only (intransigent) sinners and unbelievers!"

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: "My Lord, forgive me, my parents, and anyone who enters my home as a believer. (Forgive) the believing men and the believing women, and do not increase the evil doers in anything but doom and destruction."

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "It has been revealed to me that a (small) group of jinn heard (the Quran) and reported (it to its nation), ´We just heard a wonderful recital.´"

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: "It guides towards the right path. We believe in it, and we shall (now) never associate anyone with our Lord."

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Indeed, He _ Exalted and Majestic as He is _ did not (ever) take a mate or a son."

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: "The foolish among us, used to utter atrocious lies about Allah."

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: "We thought (and wrongly assumed) that human beings and jinn could not utter false statements about Allah."

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Some of the human beings used to invoke the support (and protection) of some (individuals among the jinn). (But) the jinn merely increased the (confusion and) disbelief of man."

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: "And people thought _ as you did _ that Allah will not resurrect anyone."

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: "We scanned (and surveyed) the sky and found it teaming with watchful guards and flaming meteors."

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Indeed, we used to seek places (in the sky) to sit and eavesdrop (on the angels). But now whoever attempts to eavesdrop finds a flaming meteor lurking around (to strike him)."

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Of course, we did not know whether a (cosmic) calamity has been planned for those on earth, or that their Lord intends to reveal to them the right path."

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Among us (jinn), there are some that are righteous, and others that are quite the opposite. We follow diverse (and divergent) paths."

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: "We have come to realize that we will never (be able to) evade Allah on earth. Nor can we ever evade Him if we run away (and leave the earth)."

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: "In fact, when we heard the guidance, we believed it. Thus, whoever believes in his Lord never needs to worry about his (good) deeds losing their worth. Nor shall he ever fear an injustice."

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Indeed, some of us (have surrendered and) are obedient, while others have deviated (from the right path). In fact, those accepting Islam (as their way of life) are really the ones seeking the right path."

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: "Those who have deviated from the right path would serve as fuel (and firewood) for hell."

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: Had they stood firm upon the way (of Islam), We would (surely) have supplied them with abundant (rain) water

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: To test them with! The Lord will immerse into an ever worsening torment, all those who turn away from the remembrance of their Lord

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: The masjids, (the mosques), are for (the worship of) Allah. So do not invoke others along with Allah

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: When the servant of Allah, (Muhammad, SAW), rose to invoke Him, they (resisted and) almost stifled him with their crowds

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "I shall pray (only) to my Lord and I shall not associate anyone with Him."

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "I really have no power to cause you any harm, nor (to make you follow) the right path."

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "No one can protect me against Allah. If (I do) not (get an asylum with Him), I will not find a place of refuge (anywhere)."

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: "(My mission is nothing) except to convey the revelations of Allah _ His messages. The fire of hell is for the one who disobeys Allah and His messenger. (That one) will stay there for ever."

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Let them wait) till they witness that which they have been promised. Very soon, they will find out whose supporters are weaker and fewer in numbers

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: Say, "I do not know if the promised punishment is (to occur in the) near (future), or if my Lord will set a distant date for it."

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Allah is) the Knower of the unseen; He does not divulge His secrets to anyone

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: Except to whomever He chooses among His messengers. (When He reveals the unseen to a messenger), He appoints (angels as) observers in front of and behind him

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: In order to monitor how the Messenger conveys the message of his Lord. He (Allah) surrounds (with his Knowledge and Power) everything that exists around them. (He knows everything)! He has counted up every single thing

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh you, (Muhammad, SAW), bundled up in clothes

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Arise and) stand (in ´salat´) during the night, save a little while

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: Half (the night), or a little less than that

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: Or, (make it) a little more (than half); and recite the Qur´an distinctly and in a slow sing-song chant

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, soon We will lay upon you a profound statement, (and entrust you with a momentous mission)

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, during the (pre dawn) hours of the night, the perception is keener and the speech more effective (and clearer)

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: You have ordinary chores to perform during the day

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: So, (at night), remember the name of your Lord and worship Him (exclusively) with sincerity and devotion

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: (He is) the Lord of the East and the West. There is no god but He! So accept Him as your guardian

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: And patiently endure what they utter, and part company with them in a handsome and polite manner

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: And, leave Me to handle (all) those who deny (the truth), those (who happen to be) living in peace and comfort. Let them, for a while

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: For them, We have shackles and the raging fire (and)

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: The food that chokes, and a painful punishment

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Let them be) then, till that day when the earth and the mountains would rock and reel violently. The mountains would turn into heaps of loosely packed sand

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course, We have sent a messenger towards you to bear witness against you, just as We sent a messenger towards the pharaoh

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: But the pharaoh defied the messenger, and so We seized him with virulent consequences

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: If you defy and disobey, how would you go through (the frightful terror of) the Day (of Judgment), which would turn even the children gray (with horror)

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: (On that day), the sky will burst asunder; His promise is (simply) bound to be fulfilled

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: This (Qur´an) is indeed a reminder. (Now), whoever wants, may take the road that leads towards his Lord

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course, Allah knows that you, and some of those with you, do stand (in ´salat´) close to two-thirds of the night. Sometimes half the night and sometimes close to one-third (of the night). Allah keeps the count of the day and the night (precisely). He knows that you cannot (always) keep time (so accurately). So He has turned to you with kindness and grace. You may recite as much of the Qur´an as you easily can. He knows that (at any given time) some of you would be sick, and others would be travelling in search of Allah´s bounties. Still others would be (engaged in) fighting for the cause of Allah. So recite as much of the Qur´an as you can, establish the ´salat´, pay the ´zakat´ and advance the virtuous loan to Allah. Whatever good deeds you send ahead for yourself are there with Allah. You will receive the rewards for your deeds (on the Day of Judgment), far better and bigger (than your deeds deserve). Seek the forgiveness of Allah, for Allah is oft-Forgiving, the most Merciful

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Oh you, wrapped up (in a cloak)

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: Get up and warn (people)

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: And announce that your Lord is the Greatest

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: Cleanse and keep your clothes purified

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: And keep clear away from filth

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Do not seek worldly gains (in return) for favors done

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: Endure (adversity) with patience, for the sake of your Lord

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Warn everyone that) the day the trumpet sounds

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Would truly be a long hard day

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: Not at all an easy day for the unbelievers

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: So, let Me handle the one whom I created all alone

12.Dr. Munir Munshey: And, I granted him wealth (and resources) in abundance

13.Dr. Munir Munshey: And sons to stand by him

14.Dr. Munir Munshey: I made life comfortable and easy for him

15.Dr. Munir Munshey: Yet, he (greedily) desires that I should grant him still more

16.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course not! Indeed, he was obstinate (and ardent) in opposing Our verses

17.Dr. Munir Munshey: Soon, I will impose a dreadful torment upon him

18.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, he pondered and plotted

19.Dr. Munir Munshey: Cursed is he, the plot he hatched

20.Dr. Munir Munshey: Once again, damned is he! What a plot he hatched

21.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, he looked around (haughtily)

22.Dr. Munir Munshey: Frowned, and signaled his displeasure

23.Dr. Munir Munshey: Finally, he turned back and displayed arrogance

24.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then said, "It is nothing but (the same old) magic handed down from antiquity."

25.Dr. Munir Munshey: "It, (the Qur´an), is merely the word of a mortal."

26.Dr. Munir Munshey: Soon, I will fling him (and roast him) in that scorcher _ (the hell)

27.Dr. Munir Munshey: And what do you think the scorcher is

28.Dr. Munir Munshey: It would not spare (anything or anyone), nor would it leave them alone (by finishing them off)

29.Dr. Munir Munshey: It will (scorch and) shrivel the human flesh

30.Dr. Munir Munshey: And over that (scorcher) are nineteen (angels standing guard)

31.Dr. Munir Munshey: We have chosen to appoint the angels as wardens over hell, and We let their number be a trial for the unbelievers. So that, those given the scriptures may believe, and the believers may increase in their belief. Both _ those given the scriptures and the believers _ may not entertain doubts. Yet, those with disease in their hearts, and the unbelievers, would still say, "What does Allah mean by this example?" Thus, Allah leads astray whom He wants, and guides whom He wants. No one knows the forces of Allah except He. This is nothing but a reminder for the mortals

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: Their reward, the paradise of Eden _ rivers run right through it _ is with their Lord. They shall live there forever. Allah is pleased with them, and they with Him! This is for the one who fears his Lord

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: When the earth is shaken up with a cataclysmic quake

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: And the earth yields and disgorges (all) its burden

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: And man remarks, "What is the matter with it?"

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day, it will recount all that ever occurred on it

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: For, your Lord shall have ordered it (to do so)

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: On that day, people will come out (of their graves) separately, so they may be shown (the result of) their deeds

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, whoever did (even) an atom´s worth of good, shall see it

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: And whoever commits an atom´s worth of evil, shall see it

100.SurahEnglishNames: The Courser, The Chargers, The Assulters

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: (I swear by) these panting snorting horses

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: Striking sparks (with their hooves)

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: Dashing to assault by dawn

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: Kicking up clouds of dust

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: And storming blindly into the crowds

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Man is indeed ungrateful to his Lord

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: And to that fact, he is himself a witness

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: He surely loves wealth and riches with a passion

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Does he not know, that when all the contents of the graves are disgorged

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: And all the secrets buried in the hearts are divulged

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day, (they would learn that) their Lord is thoroughly Knowledgeable about their deeds

101.SurahEnglishNames: The Calamity, The Stunning Blow, The Disaster, The Terrible Calamity

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: That awesome (stunning) disaster

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: What is (that) awesome disaster

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: What do you suppose is that awesome disaster

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: That day, people would be like scattered (confused) moths

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: And the mountains like the fluffy tufts of colored wool

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: Anyone whose scales (of good deeds) weigh heavier

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: Would live in a state of bliss

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: As for the one whose scale (of good deeds) is lighter

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: An abysmal pit would totally engulf him

10.Dr. Munir Munshey: And what do you think is (the content of) the abysmal pit

11.Dr. Munir Munshey: Hot blazing fire

102.SurahEnglishNames: Rivalry in World Increase, Competition, Worldly Gain

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: (Oh men! Your obsession to attain, hoard and show off) opulence diverts you (and keeps you busy)

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: Right until you land in (your) graves

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: No, surely not! You shall soon find out

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: Again, be sure! You shall soon find out

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: No, of course not! If you only knew with certainty

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: You shall surely see hell

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: Then, you would really see it with the eye of certainty

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: And then, you would certainly be called to account for the blessings and the bounties

103.SurahEnglishNames: The Declining Day, Eventide, The Epoch, Time

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: (I swear) by Time

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, mankind happens to be in a state of a grave loss

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: Except for those who believe, perform good deeds, strive for the truth, and strive with patience and perseverance

104.SurahEnglishNames: The Traducer, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer

1.Dr. Munir Munshey: Misery is for the slanderer and the backbiter

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: The one who gathers wealth; and counts it (zestfully)

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: And thinks that his wealth confers immortality

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course not! He will certainly be flung into the ´Wrecker´

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: And what do you suppose is the ´Wrecker´

6.Dr. Munir Munshey: (It is) the fire of Allah, kindled ablaze

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: Which will rise (and reach) up to (clutch) the hearts

8.Dr. Munir Munshey: Indeed, an inverted dome (of fire) would be (placed) upon them

9.Dr. Munir Munshey: Enclosed in (a fence of) tall pillars

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: He let loose upon them a large flock of birds

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: That pelted them with pellets made of baked clay

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: Thus, He turned them into the chewed out chaff

2.Dr. Munir Munshey: He is (really) the one who (shoos and) shoves away the orphans harshly

3.Dr. Munir Munshey: And does not promote the feeding of the poor

4.Dr. Munir Munshey: Of course, misery is for (some of) those who perform ´salat´

5.Dr. Munir Munshey: Those among them who stay unmindful of their "salat´

7.Dr. Munir Munshey: And they hold back even minor favors
